(Output Only) (Required) ARN of an [IAM role](iam_role.html) that CloudFront can use to send real-time log data to the Kinesis data stream.

appmesh_virtual_node.max_ejection_percent:
(Required) Maximum percentage of hosts in load balancing pool for upstream service that can be ejected. Will eject at least one host regardless of the value.
Minimum value of `0`. Maximum value of `100`.
appmesh_virtual_node.max_server_errors:
(Required) Number of consecutive `5xx` errors required for ejection. Minimum value of `1`.

The `base_ejection_duration` and `interval` objects support the following:
appmesh_virtual_node.certificate_arn:
(Required) ARN for the certificate.

The `file` object supports the following:

guardduty_organization_configuration.detector_id: (Required) The detector ID of the GuardDuty account.

transcribe_vocabulary_filter.language_code: (Required) The language code you selected for your vocabulary filter. Refer to the [supported languages](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/transcribe/latest/dg/supported-languages.html) page for accepted codes.
transcribe_vocabulary_filter.vocabulary_filter_name:
(Required) The name of the VocabularyFilter.

The following arguments are optional:

vpc_endpoint.service_name: (Required) The service name. For AWS services the service name is usually in the form `com.amazonaws.<region>.<service>` (the SageMaker Notebook service is an exception to this rule, the service name is in the form `aws.sagemaker.<region>.notebook`).
vpc_endpoint.vpc_id: (Required) The ID of the VPC in which the endpoint will be used.

securityhub_product_subscription.product_arn:
(Required) The ARN of the product that generates findings that you want to import into Security Hub - see below.

Amazon maintains a list of [Product integrations in AWS Security Hub](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/securityhub/latest/userguide/securityhub-findings-providers.html) that changes over time. Any of the products on the linked [Available AWS service integrations](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/securityhub/latest/userguide/securityhub-internal-providers.html) or [Available third-party partner product integrations](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/securityhub/latest/userguide/securityhub-partner-providers.html) can be configured using `aws_securityhub_product_subscription`.

Available products can also be listed by running the AWS CLI command `aws securityhub describe-products`.

A subset of currently available products (remember to replace `${var.region}` as appropriate) includes:

xray_group.filter_expression: (Required) The filter expression defining criteria by which to group traces. more info can be found in official [docs](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/xray/latest/devguide/xray-console-filters.html).

batch_scheduling_policy.name: (Required) Specifies the name of the scheduling policy.
batch_scheduling_policy.share_identifier: (Required) A fair share identifier or fair share identifier prefix. For more information, see [ShareAttributes](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/batch/latest/APIReference/API_ShareAttributes.html).

opsworks_ecs_cluster_layer.stack_id: (Required) ID of the stack the layer will belong to.
opsworks_ecs_cluster_layer.ecs_cluster_arn: (Required) The ECS Cluster ARN of the layer.
opsworks_ecs_cluster_layer.mount_point: (Required) The path to mount the EBS volume on the layer's instances.
opsworks_ecs_cluster_layer.size: (Required) The size of the volume in gigabytes.
opsworks_ecs_cluster_layer.number_of_disks: (Required) The number of disks to use for the EBS volume.
opsworks_ecs_cluster_layer.raid_level: (Required) The RAID level to use for the volume.

ec2_network_insights_path.source: (Required) ID or ARN of the resource which is the source of the path. Can be an Instance, Internet Gateway, Network Interface, Transit Gateway, VPC Endpoint, VPC Peering Connection or VPN Gateway. If the resource is in another account, you must specify an ARN.
ec2_network_insights_path.destination: (Required) ID or ARN of the resource which is the destination of the path. Can be an Instance, Internet Gateway, Network Interface, Transit Gateway, VPC Endpoint, VPC Peering Connection or VPN Gateway. If the resource is in another account, you must specify an ARN.
ec2_network_insights_path.protocol:
(Required) Protocol to use for analysis. Valid options are `tcp` or `udp`.

The following arguments are optional:

kms_custom_key_store.custom_key_store_name: (Required) Unique name for Custom Key Store.
kms_custom_key_store.trust_anchor_certificate: (Required) Customer certificate used for signing on CloudHSM.

cloudfront_distribution.allowed_methods: (Required) Controls which HTTP methods CloudFront processes and forwards to your Amazon S3 bucket or your custom origin.
cloudfront_distribution.cached_methods: (Required) Controls whether CloudFront caches the response to requests using the specified HTTP methods.
cloudfront_distribution.target_origin_id: (Required) Value of ID for the origin that you want CloudFront to route requests to when a request matches the path pattern either for a cache behavior or for the default cache behavior.
cloudfront_distribution.viewer_protocol_policy: (Required) Use this element to specify the protocol that users can use to access the files in the origin specified by TargetOriginId when a request matches the path pattern in PathPattern. One of `allow-all`, `https-only`, or `redirect-to-https`.
cloudfront_distribution.query_string: (Required) Indicates whether you want CloudFront to forward query strings to the origin that is associated with this cache behavior.
cloudfront_distribution.event_type: (Required) Specific event to trigger this function. Valid values: `viewer-request` or `viewer-response`.
cloudfront_distribution.forward: (Required) Whether you want CloudFront to forward cookies to the origin that is associated with this cache behavior. You can specify `all`, `none` or `whitelist`. If `whitelist`, you must include the subsequent `whitelisted_names`.
cloudfront_distribution.error_code: (Required) 4xx or 5xx HTTP status code that you want to customize.
cloudfront_distribution.bucket: (Required) Amazon S3 bucket to store the access logs in, for example, `myawslogbucket.s3.amazonaws.com`.
cloudfront_distribution.domain_name: (Required) DNS domain name of either the S3 bucket, or web site of your custom origin.
cloudfront_distribution.origin_id: (Required) Unique identifier of the member origin.
cloudfront_distribution.http_port: (Required) HTTP port the custom origin listens on.
cloudfront_distribution.https_port: (Required) HTTPS port the custom origin listens on.
cloudfront_distribution.origin_protocol_policy: (Required) Origin protocol policy to apply to your origin. One of `http-only`, `https-only`, or `match-viewer`.
cloudfront_distribution.origin_ssl_protocols: (Required) SSL/TLS protocols that you want CloudFront to use when communicating with your origin over HTTPS. A list of one or more of `SSLv3`, `TLSv1`, `TLSv1.1`, and `TLSv1.2`.
cloudfront_distribution.origin_access_identity: (Required) The [CloudFront origin access identity][5] to associate with the origin.
cloudfront_distribution.status_codes: (Required) List of HTTP status codes for the origin group.
cloudfront_distribution.locations: (Required) [ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 codes][4] for which you want CloudFront either to distribute your content (`whitelist`) or not distribute your content (`blacklist`). If the type is specified as `none` an empty array can be used.
cloudfront_distribution.restriction_type: (Required) Method that you want to use to restrict distribution of your content by country: `none`, `whitelist`, or `blacklist`.

sagemaker_pipeline.pipeline_display_name: (Required) The display name of the pipeline.
sagemaker_pipeline.role_arn: (Required) The name of the Pipeline (must be unique).

kinesis_video_stream.name:
(Required) A name to identify the stream. This is unique to the
AWS account and region the Stream is created in.

redshift_endpoint_authorization.account: (Required) The Amazon Web Services account ID to grant access to.
redshift_endpoint_authorization.cluster_identifier: (Required) The cluster identifier of the cluster to grant access to.

vpc_endpoint_route_table_association.route_table_id: (Required) Identifier of the EC2 Route Table to be associated with the VPC Endpoint.
vpc_endpoint_route_table_association.vpc_endpoint_id: (Required) Identifier of the VPC Endpoint with which the EC2 Route Table will be associated.

lightsail_database.relational_database_name: (Required) The name to use for your new Lightsail database resource. Names be unique within each AWS Region in your Lightsail account.
lightsail_database.master_database_name: (Required) The name of the master database created when the Lightsail database resource is created.
lightsail_database.blueprint_id: (Required) The blueprint ID for your new database. A blueprint describes the major engine version of a database. You can get a list of database blueprints IDs by using the AWS CLI command: `aws lightsail get-relational-database-blueprints`
lightsail_database.bundle_id: (Required)  The bundle ID for your new database. A bundle describes the performance specifications for your database (see list below). You can get a list of database bundle IDs by using the AWS CLI command: `aws lightsail get-relational-database-bundles`.
lightsail_database.final_snapshot_name: (Required unless `skip_final_snapshot = true`) The name of the database snapshot created if skip final snapshot is false, which is the default value for that parameter.

redshift_subnet_group.name: (Required) The name of the Redshift Subnet group.
redshift_subnet_group.subnet_ids: (Required) An array of VPC subnet IDs.

customer_gateway.bgp_asn: (Required) The gateway's Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) Autonomous System Number (ASN).
customer_gateway.type:
(Required) The type of customer gateway. The only type AWS
  supports at this time is "ipsec.1".

dx_gateway_association.dx_gateway_id: (Required) The ID of the Direct Connect gateway.

finspace_kx_user.name: (Required) A unique identifier for the user.
finspace_kx_user.environment_id: (Required) Unique identifier for the KX environment.
finspace_kx_user.iam_role:
(Required) IAM role ARN to be associated with the user.

The following arguments are optional:

app_cookie_stickiness_policy.name: (Required) Name of the stickiness policy.
app_cookie_stickiness_policy.load_balancer:
(Required) Name of load balancer to which the policy
  should be attached.
app_cookie_stickiness_policy.lb_port:
(Required) Load balancer port to which the policy
  should be applied. This must be an active listener on the load
balancer.
app_cookie_stickiness_policy.cookie_name: (Required) Application cookie whose lifetime the ELB's cookie should follow.

iam_openid_connect_provider.url: (Required) The URL of the identity provider. Corresponds to the _iss_ claim.
iam_openid_connect_provider.client_id_list: (Required) A list of client IDs (also known as audiences). When a mobile or web app registers with an OpenID Connect provider, they establish a value that identifies the application. (This is the value that's sent as the client_id parameter on OAuth requests.)
iam_openid_connect_provider.thumbprint_list: (Required) A list of server certificate thumbprints for the OpenID Connect (OIDC) identity provider's server certificate(s).

apigatewayv2_domain_name.domain_name: (Required) Domain name. Must be between 1 and 512 characters in length.

lightsail_lb_attachment.lb_name: (Required) The name of the Lightsail load balancer.
lightsail_lb_attachment.instance_name: (Required) The name of the instance to attach to the load balancer.

cognito_user_pool_ui_customization.user_pool_id: (Required) The user pool ID for the user pool.

lambda_alias.name: (Required) Name for the alias you are creating. Pattern: `(?!^[0-9]+$)([a-zA-Z0-9-_]+)`
lambda_alias.function_version: (Required) Lambda function version for which you are creating the alias. Pattern: `(\$LATEST|[0-9]+)`.

rum_app_monitor.name: (Required) The name of the log stream.
rum_app_monitor.domain: (Required) The top-level internet domain name for which your application has administrative authority.

resourcegroups_resource.group_arn:
(Required) The name or the ARN of the resource group to add resources to.

The following arguments are optional:
resourcegroups_resource.resource_arn: (Required) The ARN of the resource to be added to the group.

ec2_transit_gateway_route.destination_cidr_block: (Required) IPv4 or IPv6 RFC1924 CIDR used for destination matches. Routing decisions are based on the most specific match.
ec2_transit_gateway_route.transit_gateway_attachment_id: (Optional) Identifier of EC2 Transit Gateway Attachment (required if `blackhole` is set to false).
ec2_transit_gateway_route.transit_gateway_route_table_id: (Required) Identifier of EC2 Transit Gateway Route Table.

route53_vpc_association_authorization.zone_id: (Required) The ID of the private hosted zone that you want to authorize associating a VPC with.
route53_vpc_association_authorization.vpc_id: (Required) The VPC to authorize for association with the private hosted zone.

ec2_carrier_gateway.vpc_id: (Required) The ID of the VPC to associate with the carrier gateway.

lightsail_bucket.name: (Required) The name for the bucket.
lightsail_bucket.bundle_id: - (Required) The ID of the bundle to use for the bucket. A bucket bundle specifies the monthly cost, storage space, and data transfer quota for a bucket. Use the [get-bucket-bundles](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/reference/lightsail/get-bucket-bundles.html) cli command to get a list of bundle IDs that you can specify.

iot_policy_attachment.policy: (Required) The name of the policy to attach.
iot_policy_attachment.target: (Required) The identity to which the policy is attached.

ivschat_logging_configuration.destination_configuration: (Required) Object containing destination configuration for where chat activity will be logged. This object must contain exactly one of the following children arguments:

opensearchserverless_security_policy.name: (Required) Name of the policy.
opensearchserverless_security_policy.policy: (Required) JSON policy document to use as the content for the new policy
opensearchserverless_security_policy.type:
(Required) Type of security policy. One of `encryption` or `network`.

The following arguments are optional:

s3control_bucket_policy.bucket: (Required) Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket.
s3control_bucket_policy.policy: (Required) JSON string of the resource policy. For more information about building AWS IAM policy documents with Terraform, see the [AWS IAM Policy Document Guide](https://learn.hashicorp.com/terraform/aws/iam-policy).

cloudformation_stack_set.name: (Required) Name of the StackSet. The name must be unique in the region where you create your StackSet. The name can contain only alphanumeric characters (case-sensitive) and hyphens. It must start with an alphabetic character and cannot be longer than 128 characters.

fis_experiment_template.role_arn: (Required) ARN of an IAM role that grants the AWS FIS service permission to perform service actions on your behalf.
fis_experiment_template.name: (Required) Friendly name given to the target.
fis_experiment_template.selection_mode: (Required) Scopes the identified resources. Valid values are `ALL` (all identified resources), `COUNT(n)` (randomly select `n` of the identified resources), `PERCENT(n)` (randomly select `n` percent of the identified resources).
fis_experiment_template.values:
(Required) Set of attribute values for the filter.

~> NOTE: Values specified in a `filter` are joined with an `OR` clause, while values across multiple `filter` blocks are joined with an `AND` clause. For more information, see [Targets for AWS FIS](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/fis/latest/userguide/targets.html#target-filters).

storagegateway_upload_buffer.gateway_arn: (Required) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway.

ram_resource_association.resource_arn: (Required) Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to associate with the RAM Resource Share.
ram_resource_association.resource_share_arn: (Required) Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the RAM Resource Share.

glue_ml_transform.name: (Required) The name you assign to this ML Transform. It must be unique in your account.
glue_ml_transform.role_arn: (Required) The ARN of the IAM role associated with this ML Transform.
glue_ml_transform.find_matches_parameters: (Required) The parameters for the find matches algorithm. see [Find Matches Parameters](#find_matches_parameters).

servicequotas_service_quota.quota_code: (Required) Code of the service quota to track. For example: `L-F678F1CE`. Available values can be found with the [AWS CLI service-quotas list-service-quotas command](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/reference/service-quotas/list-service-quotas.html).
servicequotas_service_quota.service_code: (Required) Code of the service to track. For example: `vpc`. Available values can be found with the [AWS CLI service-quotas list-services command](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/reference/service-quotas/list-services.html).
servicequotas_service_quota.value: (Required) Float specifying the desired value for the service quota. If the desired value is higher than the current value, a quota increase request is submitted. When a known request is submitted and pending, the value reflects the desired value of the pending request.

lambda_event_source_mapping.function_name: (Required) The name or the ARN of the Lambda function that will be subscribing to events.
lambda_event_source_mapping.destination_arn: (Required) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the destination resource.
lambda_event_source_mapping.database_name: (Required) The name of the database to consume within the DocumentDB cluster.
lambda_event_source_mapping.endpoints: (Required) A map of endpoints for the self managed source.  For Kafka self-managed sources, the key should be `KAFKA_BOOTSTRAP_SERVERS` and the value should be a string with a comma separated list of broker endpoints.
lambda_event_source_mapping.type: (Required) The type of this configuration.  For Self Managed Kafka you will need to supply blocks for type `VPC_SUBNET` and `VPC_SECURITY_GROUP`.
lambda_event_source_mapping.uri: (Required) The URI for this configuration.  For type `VPC_SUBNET` the value should be `subnet:subnet_id` where `subnet_id` is the value you would find in an aws_subnet resource's id attribute.  For type `VPC_SECURITY_GROUP` the value should be `security_group:security_group_id` where `security_group_id` is the value you would find in an aws_security_group resource's id attribute.

opensearch_outbound_connection.connection_alias: (Required, Forces new resource) Specifies the connection alias that will be used by the customer for this connection.
opensearch_outbound_connection.connection_mode: (Required, Forces new resource) Specifies the connection mode. Accepted values are `DIRECT` or `VPC_ENDPOINT`.

route53recoverycontrolconfig_routing_con.cluster_arn: (Required) ARN of the cluster in which this routing control will reside.
route53recoverycontrolconfig_routing_con.name:
(Required) The name describing the routing control.

ce_cost_category.name: (Required) Unique name for the Cost Category.
ce_cost_category.rule_version: (Required) Rule schema version in this particular Cost Category.

resourceexplorer2_index.type: (Required) The type of the index. Valid values: `AGGREGATOR`, `LOCAL`. To understand the difference between `LOCAL` and `AGGREGATOR`, see the [_AWS Resource Explorer User Guide_](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/resource-explorer/latest/userguide/manage-aggregator-region.html).

appstream_stack.name:
(Required) Unique name for the AppStream stack.

sesv2_configuration_set_event_destinatio.configuration_set_name: (Required) The name of the configuration set.
sesv2_configuration_set_event_destinatio.event_destination_name: (Required) An object that defines the event destination. See [event_destination](#event_destination) below.

fsx_lustre_file_system.subnet_ids: (Required) A list of IDs for the subnets that the file system will be accessible from. File systems currently support only one subnet. The file server is also launched in that subnet's Availability Zone.

storagegateway_working_storage.gateway_arn: (Required) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway.

signer_signing_profile.platform_id: (Required) The ID of the platform that is used by the target signing profile.

location_geofence_collection.collection_name:

volume_attachment.volume_id: (Required) ID of the Volume to be attached

vpc_peering_connection_accepter.vpc_peering_connection_id: (Required) The VPC Peering Connection ID to manage.

codedeploy_deployment_group.deployment_group_name: (Required) The name of the deployment group.

See [the CodeDeploy documentation][1] for all possible values.
codedeploy_deployment_group.trigger_name: (Required) The name of the notification trigger.
codedeploy_deployment_group.trigger_target_arn: (Required) The ARN of the SNS topic through which notifications are sent.

route53_resolver_rule_association.resolver_rule_id: (Required) The ID of the resolver rule that you want to associate with the VPC.
route53_resolver_rule_association.vpc_id: (Required) The ID of the VPC that you want to associate the resolver rule with.

s3control_object_lambda_access_point.name: (Required) The name for this Object Lambda Access Point.

ses_event_destination.default_value: (Required) The default value for the event
ses_event_destination.value_source: (Required) The source for the value. May be any of `"messageTag"`, `"emailHeader"` or `"linkTag"`.
ses_event_destination.stream_arn: (Required) The ARN of the Kinesis Stream
ses_event_destination.role_arn: (Required) The ARN of the role that has permissions to access the Kinesis Stream
ses_event_destination.topic_arn: (Required) The ARN of the SNS topic

backup_vault.name: (Required) Name of the backup vault to create.

dax_cluster.cluster_name:

(Required) The compute and memory capacity of the nodes. See

elastic_beanstalk_environment.name:

location_tracker_association.tracker_name: (Required) The name of the tracker resource to be associated with a geofence collection.

dx_hosted_public_virtual_interface.route_filter_prefixes: (Required) A list of routes to be advertised to the AWS network in this region.

guardduty_ipset.activate: (Required) Specifies whether GuardDuty is to start using the uploaded IPSet.

ami.image_location:
(Required) Path to an S3 object containing an image manifest, e.g., created
  by the `ec2-upload-bundle` command in the EC2 command line tools.
ami.kernel_id:
(Required) ID of the kernel image (AKI) that will be used as the paravirtual
  kernel in created instances.
ami.device_name: (Required) Path at which the device is exposed to created instances.
ami.iops:
(Required only when `volume_type` is `io1` or `io2`) Number of I/O operations per second the
  created volumes will support.
ami.volume_size:
(Required unless `snapshot_id` is set) Size of created volumes in GiB.
  If `snapshot_id` is set and `volume_size` is omitted then the volume will have the same size
  as the selected snapshot.
ami.virtual_name:
(Required) Name for the ephemeral device, of the form "ephemeralN" where
  N is a volume number starting from zero.

cloudwatch_query_definition.name: (Required) The name of the query.
cloudwatch_query_definition.query_string: (Required) The query to save. You can read more about CloudWatch Logs Query Syntax in the [documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/logs/CWL_QuerySyntax.html).

wafv2_web_acl_association.resource_arn: (Required) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to associate with the web ACL. This must be an ARN of an Application Load Balancer, an Amazon API Gateway stage, an Amazon Cognito User Pool, an Amazon AppSync GraphQL API, an Amazon App Runner service, or an Amazon Verified Access instance.
wafv2_web_acl_association.web_acl_arn: (Required) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Web ACL that you want to associate with the resource.

sqs_queue_policy.queue_url: (Required) The URL of the SQS Queue to which to attach the policy
sqs_queue_policy.policy: (Required) The JSON policy for the SQS queue. For more information about building AWS IAM policy documents with Terraform, see the [AWS IAM Policy Document Guide](https://learn.hashicorp.com/terraform/aws/iam-policy).

transfer_workflow.steps: (Required) Specifies the details for the steps that are in the specified workflow. See Workflow Steps below.
transfer_workflow.type: (Required) The type of encryption used. Currently, this value must be `"PGP"`.
transfer_workflow.key: (Required) The name assigned to the tag that you create.
transfer_workflow.value: (Required) The value that corresponds to the key.

connect_queue.hours_of_operation_id: (Required) Specifies the identifier of the Hours of Operation.
connect_queue.instance_id: (Required) Specifies the identifier of the hosting Amazon Connect Instance.
connect_queue.name: (Required) Specifies the name of the Queue.

finspace_kx_cluster.az_mode: (Required) The number of availability zones you want to assign per cluster. This can be one of the following:

vpc_network_performance_metric_subscript.source: (Required) The source Region or Availability Zone that the metric subscription is enabled for. For example, `us-east-1`.

qldb_stream.inclusive_start_time: (Required) The inclusive start date and time from which to start streaming journal data. This parameter must be in ISO 8601 date and time format and in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). For example: `"2019-06-13T21:36:34Z"`.  This cannot be in the future and must be before `exclusive_end_time`.  If you provide a value that is before the ledger's `CreationDateTime`, QLDB effectively defaults it to the ledger's `CreationDateTime`.
qldb_stream.ledger_name: (Required) The name of the QLDB ledger.
qldb_stream.role_arn: (Required) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that grants QLDB permissions for a journal stream to write data records to a Kinesis Data Streams resource.
qldb_stream.stream_name: (Required) The name that you want to assign to the QLDB journal stream. User-defined names can help identify and indicate the purpose of a stream.  Your stream name must be unique among other active streams for a given ledger. Stream names have the same naming constraints as ledger names, as defined in the [Amazon QLDB Developer Guide](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/qldb/latest/developerguide/limits.html#limits.naming).

Depends on `cognito_identity_providers` set on `aws_cognito_identity_pool` resource or a `aws_cognito_identity_provider` resource.

ssm_document.content: (Required) The JSON or YAML content of the document.

connect_lambda_function_association.function_arn: (Required) Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Lambda Function, omitting any version or alias qualifier.
connect_lambda_function_association.instance_id: (Required) The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the instanceId in the ARN of the instance.

dms_endpoint.endpoint_id: (Required) Database endpoint identifier. Identifiers must contain from 1 to 255 alphanumeric characters or hyphens, begin with a letter, contain only ASCII letters, digits, and hyphens, not end with a hyphen, and not contain two consecutive hyphens.
dms_endpoint.endpoint_type: (Required) Type of endpoint. Valid values are `source`, `target`.
dms_endpoint.engine_name: (Required) Type of engine for the endpoint. Valid values are `aurora`, `aurora-postgresql`, `azuredb`, `azure-sql-managed-instance`, `babelfish`, `db2`, `db2-zos`, `docdb`, `dynamodb`, `elasticsearch`, `kafka`, `kinesis`, `mariadb`, `mongodb`, `mysql`, `opensearch`, `oracle`, `postgres`, `redshift`, `s3`, `sqlserver`, `sybase`. Please note that some of engine names are available only for `target` endpoint type (e.g. `redshift`).
dms_endpoint.kms_key_arn:
(Required when `engine_name` is `mongodb`, cannot be set when `engine_name` is `s3`, optional otherwise) ARN for the KMS key that will be used to encrypt the connection parameters. If you do not specify a value for `kms_key_arn`, then AWS DMS will use your default encryption key. AWS KMS creates the default encryption key for your AWS account. Your AWS account has a different default encryption key for each AWS region. To encrypt an S3 target with a KMS Key, use the parameter `s3_settings.server_side_encryption_kms_key_id`. When `engine_name` is `redshift`, `kms_key_arn` is the KMS Key for the Redshift target and the parameter `redshift_settings.server_side_encryption_kms_key_id` encrypts the S3 intermediate storage.

The following arguments are optional:

The `auth-token` option requires an `auth_password` value to be provided. The `auth-role` option requires `auth_user_name` and `auth_password` values to be provided.

wafregional_regex_match_set.name: (Required) The name or description of the Regex Match Set.

  e.g., `CMD_LINE`, `HTML_ENTITY_DECODE` or `NONE`.
  See [docs](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/waf/latest/APIReference/API_ByteMatchTuple.html#WAF-Type-ByteMatchTuple-TextTransformation)
  for all supported values.
wafregional_regex_match_set.type:
(Required) The part of the web request that you want AWS WAF to search for a specified string.
  e.g., `HEADER`, `METHOD` or `BODY`.
  See [docs](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/waf/latest/APIReference/API_FieldToMatch.html)
  for all supported values.

medialive_channel.input_specification: (Required) Specification of network and file inputs for the channel.
medialive_channel.track: (Required) 1-based integer value that maps to a specific audio track.
medialive_channel.height: (Required) See the description in left\_offset. For height, specify the entire height of the rectangle as a percentage of the underlying frame height. For example, "80" means the rectangle height is 80% of the underlying frame height. The top\_offset and rectangle\_height must add up to 100% or less. This field corresponds to tts:extent - Y in the TTML standard.
medialive_channel.left_offset: (Required) Applies only if you plan to convert these source captions to EBU-TT-D or TTML in an output. (Make sure to leave the default if you donâ€™t have either of these formats in the output.) You can define a display rectangle for the captions that is smaller than the underlying video frame. You define the rectangle by specifying the position of the left edge, top edge, bottom edge, and right edge of the rectangle, all within the underlying video frame. The units for the measurements are percentages. If you specify a value for one of these fields, you must specify a value for all of them. For leftOffset, specify the position of the left edge of the rectangle, as a percentage of the underlying frame width, and relative to the left edge of the frame. For example, "10" means the measurement is 10% of the underlying frame width. The rectangle left edge starts at that position from the left edge of the frame. This field corresponds to tts:origin - X in the TTML standard.
medialive_channel.top_offset: (Required) See the description in left\_offset. For top\_offset, specify the position of the top edge of the rectangle, as a percentage of the underlying frame height, and relative to the top edge of the frame. For example, "10" means the measurement is 10% of the underlying frame height. The rectangle top edge starts at that position from the top edge of the frame. This field corresponds to tts:origin - Y in the TTML standard.
medialive_channel.width: (Required) See the description in left\_offset. For width, specify the entire width of the rectangle as a percentage of the underlying frame width. For example, "80" means the rectangle width is 80% of the underlying frame width. The left\_offset and rectangle\_width must add up to 100% or less. This field corresponds to tts:extent - X in the TTML standard.

  One of `en`, `es`, `fr`, `it`, `de`, or `pt`.

(Required) Name for the Entity Recognizer.

The following arguments are optional:

dlm_lifecycle_policy.description: (Required) A description for the DLM lifecycle policy.
dlm_lifecycle_policy.execution_role_arn: (Required) The ARN of an IAM role that is able to be assumed by the DLM service.
dlm_lifecycle_policy.retain_rule: (Required) The retention rule that indicates how long snapshot copies are to be retained in the destination Region. See the [`retain_rule`](#cross-region-copy-rule-retain-rule-arguments) block. Max of 1 per schedule.
dlm_lifecycle_policy.target: (Required) The target Region or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the target Outpost for the snapshot copies.
dlm_lifecycle_policy.encrypted: (Required) To encrypt a copy of an unencrypted snapshot if encryption by default is not enabled, enable encryption using this parameter. Copies of encrypted snapshots are encrypted, even if this parameter is false or if encryption by default is not enabled.
dlm_lifecycle_policy.parameters: (Required) Information about the event. See the [`parameters` configuration](#event-source-parameters-arguments) block.
dlm_lifecycle_policy.type: (Required) The source of the event. Currently only managed CloudWatch Events rules are supported. Valid values are `MANAGED_CWE`.
dlm_lifecycle_policy.description_regex: (Required) The snapshot description that can trigger the policy. The description pattern is specified using a regular expression. The policy runs only if a snapshot with a description that matches the specified pattern is shared with your account.
dlm_lifecycle_policy.event_type: (Required) The type of event. Currently, only `shareSnapshot` events are supported.
dlm_lifecycle_policy.snapshot_owner: (Required) The IDs of the AWS accounts that can trigger policy by sharing snapshots with your account. The policy only runs if one of the specified AWS accounts shares a snapshot with your account.
dlm_lifecycle_policy.name: (Required) A name for the schedule.
dlm_lifecycle_policy.availability_zones: (Required) The Availability Zones in which to enable fast snapshot restore.
dlm_lifecycle_policy.target_accounts: (Required) The IDs of the AWS accounts with which to share the snapshots.
dlm_lifecycle_policy.interval: (Required) The amount of time to retain each snapshot. The maximum is 100 years. This is equivalent to 1200 months, 5200 weeks, or 36500 days.
dlm_lifecycle_policy.interval_unit: (Required) The unit of time for time-based retention. Valid values: `DAYS`, `WEEKS`, `MONTHS`, or `YEARS`.

ec2_traffic_mirror_filter_rule.rule_number: (Required) Number of the Traffic Mirror rule. This number must be unique for each Traffic Mirror rule in a given direction. The rules are processed in ascending order by rule number.
ec2_traffic_mirror_filter_rule.source_cidr_block: (Required) Source CIDR block to assign to the Traffic Mirror rule.

(Required) Direction of traffic to be captured. Valid values are `ingress` and `egress`

route53recoveryreadiness_resource_set.resource_set_type: (Required) Type of the resources in the resource set.

Set to `"NONE"` to bypass IAM authentication and create a public endpoint. See the [AWS documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/lambda/latest/dg/urls-auth.html) for more details.

securityhub_insight.group_by_attribute: (Required) The attribute used to group the findings for the insight e.g., if an insight is grouped by `ResourceId`, then the insight produces a list of resource identifiers.

securityhub_insight.key: (Required) The key of the map filter. For example, for `ResourceTags`, `Key` identifies the name of the tag. For `UserDefinedFields`, `Key` is the name of the field.

By default, fail open is disabled, which means the failure mode is closed. This approach favors security over availability. DNS Firewall blocks queries that it is unable to evaluate properly. If you enable this option, the failure mode is open. This approach favors availability over security. DNS Firewall allows queries to proceed if it is unable to properly evaluate them. Valid values: `ENABLED`, `DISABLED`.

The specified Statistic value is used as the first operand. Either of the following is supported: `GreaterThanOrEqualToThreshold`, `GreaterThanThreshold`, `LessThanThreshold`, `LessThanOrEqualToThreshold`. Additionally, the values  `LessThanLowerOrGreaterThanUpperThreshold`, `LessThanLowerThreshold`, and `GreaterThanUpperThreshold` are used only for alarms based on anomaly detection models.
cloudwatch_metric_alarm.evaluation_periods: (Required) The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified threshold.

If you are performing math expressions on this set of data, this name represents that data and can serve as a variable in the mathematical expression. The valid characters are letters, numbers, and underscore. The first character must be a lowercase letter.

  See docs for [supported metrics](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/DeveloperGuide/CW_Support_For_AWS.html).

(Required) Granularity in seconds of returned data points.

(Required) Target resource of the pipe (typically an ARN).

The following arguments are optional:
pipes_pipe.pattern: (Required) The event pattern. At most 4096 characters.
pipes_pipe.queue_name: (Required) The name of the destination queue to consume. Maximum length of 1000.
pipes_pipe.basic_auth: (Required) The ARN of the Secrets Manager secret containing the credentials.
pipes_pipe.starting_position: (Required) The position in a stream from which to start reading. Valid values: TRIM_HORIZON, LATEST, AT_TIMESTAMP.
pipes_pipe.topic_name: (Required) The name of the topic that the pipe will read from. Maximum length of 249.
pipes_pipe.job_definition: (Required) The job definition used by this job. This value can be one of name, name:revision, or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the job definition. If name is specified without a revision then the latest active revision is used.
pipes_pipe.job_name: (Required) The name of the job. It can be up to 128 letters long.
pipes_pipe.size_in_gib: (Required) The total amount, in GiB, of ephemeral storage to set for the task. The minimum supported value is 21 GiB and the maximum supported value is 200 GiB.
pipes_pipe.partition_key: (Required) Determines which shard in the stream the data record is assigned to. Partition keys are Unicode strings with a maximum length limit of 256 characters for each key. Amazon Kinesis Data Streams uses the partition key as input to a hash function that maps the partition key and associated data to a specific shard. Specifically, an MD5 hash function is used to map partition keys to 128-bit integer values and to map associated data records to shards. As a result of this hashing mechanism, all data records with the same partition key map to the same shard within the stream.
pipes_pipe.database: (Required) The name of the database. Required when authenticating using temporary credentials.

ec2_subnet_cidr_reservation.subnet_id: (Required) The ID of the subnet to create the reservation for.

fsx_file_cache.file_cache_path: (Required) A path on the cache that points to a high-level directory (such as /ns1/) or subdirectory (such as /ns1/subdir/) that will be mapped 1-1 with DataRepositoryPath. The leading forward slash in the name is required. Two data repository associations cannot have overlapping cache paths. For example, if a data repository is associated with cache path /ns1/, then you cannot link another data repository with cache path /ns1/ns2. This path specifies where in your cache files will be exported from. This cache directory can be linked to only one data repository, and no data repository other can be linked to the directory. Note: The cache path can only be set to root (/) on an NFS DRA when DataRepositorySubdirectories is specified. If you specify root (/) as the cache path, you can create only one DRA on the cache. The cache path cannot be set to root (/) for an S3 DRA.
fsx_file_cache.version: - (Required) The version of the NFS (Network File System) protocol of the NFS data repository. The only supported value is NFS3, which indicates that the data repository must support the NFSv3 protocol. The only supported value is `NFS3`.
fsx_file_cache.deployment_type: (Required) Specifies the cache deployment type. The only supported value is `CACHE_1`.
fsx_file_cache.per_unit_storage_throughput: (Required) Provisions the amount of read and write throughput for each 1 tebibyte (TiB) of cache storage capacity, in MB/s/TiB. The only supported value is `1000`.
fsx_file_cache.storage_capacity: (Required) The storage capacity of the Lustre MDT (Metadata Target) storage volume in gibibytes (GiB). The only supported value is `2400` GiB.

organizations_account.email: (Required) Email address of the owner to assign to the new member account. This email address must not already be associated with another AWS account.

(Required) Friendly name for the member account.

cur_report_definition.format: (Required) Format for report. Valid values are: `textORcsv`, `Parquet`. If `Parquet` is used, then Compression must also be `Parquet`.
cur_report_definition.compression: (Required) Compression format for report. Valid values are: `GZIP`, `ZIP`, `Parquet`. If `Parquet` is used, then format must also be `Parquet`.
cur_report_definition.additional_schema_elements: (Required) A list of schema elements. Valid values are: `RESOURCES`, `SPLIT_COST_ALLOCATION_DATA`.
cur_report_definition.s3_bucket: (Required) Name of the existing S3 bucket to hold generated reports.
cur_report_definition.s3_region: (Required) Region of the existing S3 bucket to hold generated reports.
cur_report_definition.additional_artifacts: (Required) A list of additional artifacts. Valid values are: `REDSHIFT`, `QUICKSIGHT`, `ATHENA`. When ATHENA exists within additional_artifacts, no other artifact type can be declared and report_versioning must be `OVERWRITE_REPORT`.

For more information, see [IAM roles for Amazon Kendra](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/kendra/latest/dg/iam-roles.html).

For more information about building policy documents with Terraform, see the [AWS IAM Policy Document Guide](https://learn.hashicorp.com/terraform/aws/iam-policy).

~> NOTE: Note: All KMS keys must have a key policy. If a key policy is not specified, or this resource is destroyed, AWS gives the KMS key a [default key policy](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/kms/latest/developerguide/key-policies.html#key-policy-default) that gives all principals in the owning account unlimited access to all KMS operations for the key. cloudwatch_metric_stream.include_metric: (Required) An array that defines the metrics that are to have additional statistics streamed. See details below.

apigatewayv2_api.name: (Required) Name of the API. Must be less than or equal to 128 characters in length.

dynamodb_table.s3_bucket_source: (Required) Values for the S3 bucket the source file is imported from. See below.

route53_record.ttl: (Required for non-alias records) The TTL of the record.
route53_record.records: (Required for non-alias records) A string list of records. To specify a single record value longer than 255 characters such as a TXT record for DKIM, add `\"\"` inside the Terraform configuration string (e.g., `"first255characters\"\"morecharacters"`).

internet_gateway_attachment.internet_gateway_id: (Required) The ID of the internet gateway.

media_package_channel.channel_id: (Required) A unique identifier describing the channel

lb_listener_certificate.listener_arn: (Required, Forces New Resource) The ARN of the listener to which to attach the certificate.
lb_listener_certificate.certificate_arn: (Required, Forces New Resource) The ARN of the certificate to attach to the listener.

quicksight_analysis.analysis_id: (Required, Forces new resource) Identifier for the analysis.
quicksight_analysis.name:
(Required) Display name for the analysis.

codecommit_trigger.repository_name: (Required) The name for the repository. This needs to be less than 100 characters.
codecommit_trigger.name: (Required) The name of the trigger.
codecommit_trigger.destination_arn: (Required) The ARN of the resource that is the target for a trigger. For example, the ARN of a topic in Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS).
codecommit_trigger.events: (Required) The repository events that will cause the trigger to run actions in another service, such as sending a notification through Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS). If no events are specified, the trigger will run for all repository events. Event types include: `all`, `updateReference`, `createReference`, `deleteReference`.

config_remediation_configuration.config_rule_name: (Required) Name of the AWS Config rule.
config_remediation_configuration.target_id: (Required) Target ID is the name of the public document.
config_remediation_configuration.target_type:
(Required) Type of the target. Target executes remediation. For example, SSM document.

config_remediation_configuration.ssm_controls: (Required) Configuration block for SSM controls. See below.

s3control_bucket_lifecycle_configuration.bucket: (Required) Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket.
s3control_bucket_lifecycle_configuration.rule: (Required) Configuration block(s) containing lifecycle rules for the bucket.
s3control_bucket_lifecycle_configuration.days_after_initiation: (Required) Number of days after which Amazon S3 aborts an incomplete multipart upload.

vpn_connection.customer_gateway_id: (Required) The ID of the customer gateway.
vpn_connection.type: (Required) The type of VPN connection. The only type AWS supports at this time is "ipsec.1".
vpn_connection.transport_transit_gateway_attachment_id: (Required when outside_ip_address_type is set to `PrivateIpv4`). The attachment ID of the Transit Gateway attachment to Direct Connect Gateway. The ID is obtained through a data source only.

iam_group_policy.policy: (Required) The policy document. This is a JSON formatted string. For more information about building IAM policy documents with Terraform, see the [AWS IAM Policy Document Guide](https://learn.hashicorp.com/terraform/aws/iam-policy)
iam_group_policy.group: (Required) The IAM group to attach to the policy.

waf_byte_match_set.name: (Required) The name or description of the Byte Match Set.

cloudfront_function.name: (Required) Unique name for your CloudFront Function.
cloudfront_function.runtime:
(Required) Identifier of the function's runtime. Currently only `cloudfront-js-1.0` is valid.

The following arguments are optional:

ebs_volume.availability_zone: (Required) The AZ where the EBS volume will exist.

wafv2_regex_pattern_set.name: (Required) A friendly name of the regular expression pattern set.
wafv2_regex_pattern_set.scope: (Required) Specifies whether this is for an AWS CloudFront distribution or for a regional application. Valid values are `CLOUDFRONT` or `REGIONAL`. To work with CloudFront, you must also specify the region `us-east-1` (N. Virginia) on the AWS provider.

prometheus_rule_group_namespace.name: (Required) The name of the rule group namespace
prometheus_rule_group_namespace.workspace_id: (Required) ID of the prometheus workspace the rule group namespace should be linked to
prometheus_rule_group_namespace.data: (Required) the rule group namespace data that you want to be applied. See more [in AWS Docs](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/prometheus/latest/userguide/AMP-Ruler.html).

cleanrooms_collaboration.name: - (Required) The name of the collaboration.  Collaboration names do not need to be unique.
cleanrooms_collaboration.creator_member_abilities: - (Required - Forces new resource) The list of member abilities for the creator of the collaboration.  Valid values [may be found here](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/clean-rooms/latest/apireference/API_CreateCollaboration.html#API-CreateCollaboration-request-creatorMemberAbilities).
cleanrooms_collaboration.creator_display_name: - (Required - Forces new resource) The name for the member record for the collaboration creator.
cleanrooms_collaboration.query_log_status:
- (Required - Forces new resource) Determines if members of the collaboration can enable query logs within their own.
emberships. Valid values [may be found here](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/clean-rooms/latest/apireference/API_CreateCollaboration.html#API-CreateCollaboration-request-queryLogStatus).
cleanrooms_collaboration.data_encryption_metadata: - (Required - Forces new resource) a collection of settings which determine how the [c3r client](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/clean-rooms/latest/userguide/crypto-computing.html) will encrypt data for use within this collaboration.

cloudfront_field_level_encryption_config.content_type: (Required) he content type for a field-level encryption content type-profile mapping. Valid value is `application/x-www-form-urlencoded`.
cloudfront_field_level_encryption_config.format: (Required) The format for a field-level encryption content type-profile mapping. Valid value is `URLEncoded`.
cloudfront_field_level_encryption_config.profile_id: (Required) ID of profile to use for field-level encryption query argument-profile mapping
cloudfront_field_level_encryption_config.query_arg: (Required) Query argument for field-level encryption query argument-profile mapping.

gamelift_alias.name: (Required) Name of the alias.
gamelift_alias.routing_strategy: (Required) Specifies the fleet and/or routing type to use for the alias.

secretsmanager_secret_version.secret_id: (Required) Specifies the secret to which you want to add a new version. You can specify either the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or the friendly name of the secret. The secret must already exist.

macie2_classification_job.job_type: (Required) The schedule for running the job. Valid values are: `ONE_TIME` - Run the job only once. If you specify this value, don't specify a value for the `schedule_frequency` property. `SCHEDULED` - Run the job on a daily, weekly, or monthly basis. If you specify this value, use the `schedule_frequency` property to define the recurrence pattern for the job.
macie2_classification_job.comparator: (Required) The operator to use in the condition. Valid combination and values are available in the [AWS Documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/macie/latest/APIReference/jobs.html#jobs-model-jobcomparator)
macie2_classification_job.key: (Required) The tag key to use in the condition. The only valid value is `TAG`.
macie2_classification_job.values:
(Required) An array that lists the values to use in the condition. Valid combination of values are available in the [AWS Documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/macie/latest/APIReference/jobs.html#jobs-model-simplecriterionforjob)

The `tag_criterion` object supports the following:
macie2_classification_job.account_id: (Required) The unique identifier for the AWS account that owns the buckets.
macie2_classification_job.buckets: (Required) An array that lists the names of the buckets.
macie2_classification_job.target: (Required) The type of object to apply the condition to. The only valid value is `S3_OBJECT`.

rds_export_task.export_task_identifier: (Required) Unique identifier for the snapshot export task.
rds_export_task.iam_role_arn: (Required) ARN of the IAM role to use for writing to the Amazon S3 bucket.
rds_export_task.kms_key_id: (Required) ID of the Amazon Web Services KMS key to use to encrypt the snapshot.
rds_export_task.s3_bucket_name: (Required) Name of the Amazon S3 bucket to export the snapshot to.
rds_export_task.source_arn:
(Required) Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the snapshot to export.

cloudwatch_event_permission.principal: (Required) The 12-digit AWS account ID that you are permitting to put events to your default event bus. Specify `

appflow_connector_profile.name_: (Required) Name of the connector profile. The name is unique for each `ConnectorProfile` in your AWS account.
appflow_connector_profile.connection_mode: (Required) Indicates the connection mode and specifies whether it is public or private. Private flows use AWS PrivateLink to route data over AWS infrastructure without exposing it to the public internet. One of: `Public`, `Private`.
appflow_connector_profile.connector_type: (Required) The type of connector. One of: `Amplitude`, `CustomConnector`, `CustomerProfiles`, `Datadog`, `Dynatrace`, `EventBridge`, `Googleanalytics`, `Honeycode`, `Infornexus`, `LookoutMetrics`, `Marketo`, `Redshift`, `S3`, `Salesforce`, `SAPOData`, `Servicenow`, `Singular`, `Slack`, `Snowflake`, `Trendmicro`, `Upsolver`, `Veeva`, `Zendesk`.

iam_security_token_service_preferences.global_endpoint_token_version: (Required) The version of the STS global endpoint token. Valid values: `v1Token`, `v2Token`.

(Required) The replication instance identifier. This parameter is stored as a lowercase string.

    - Cannot contain two consecutive hyphens.

lambda_permission.function_name: (Required) Name of the Lambda function whose resource policy you are updating
lambda_permission.principal: (Required) The principal who is getting this permission e.g., `s3.amazonaws.com`, an AWS account ID, or AWS IAM principal, or AWS service principal such as `events.amazonaws.com` or `sns.amazonaws.com`.

db_instance_role_association.role_arn: (Required) Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM Role to associate with the DB Instance.

service_discovery_private_dns_namespace.name: (Required) The name of the namespace.

cloudfront_realtime_log_config.endpoint: (Required) The Amazon Kinesis data streams where real-time log data is sent.

(Required) The sampling rate for this real-time log configuration. The sampling rate determines the percentage of viewer requests that are represented in the real-time log data. An integer between `1` and `100`, inclusive.

cloudfront_realtime_log_config.kinesis_stream_config: (Required) The Amazon Kinesis data stream configuration.

The `kinesis_stream_config` object supports the following:

(Required) The ARN of an [IAM role](iam_role.html) that CloudFront can use to send real-time log data to the Kinesis data stream.
See the [AWS documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudFront/latest/DeveloperGuide/real-time-logs.html#understand-real-time-log-config-iam-role) for more information.
cloudfront_realtime_log_config.stream_arn: (Required) The ARN of the [Kinesis data stream](kinesis_stream.html).

storagegateway_cached_iscsi_volume.target_name: (Required) The name of the iSCSI target used by initiators to connect to the target and as a suffix for the target ARN. The target name must be unique across all volumes of a gateway.
storagegateway_cached_iscsi_volume.volume_size_in_bytes: (Required) The size of the volume in bytes.

fsx_windows_file_system.subnet_ids: (Required) A list of IDs for the subnets that the file system will be accessible from. To specify more than a single subnet set `deployment_type` to `MULTI_AZ_1`.
fsx_windows_file_system.throughput_capacity:
(Required) Throughput (megabytes per second) of the file system in power of 2 increments. Minimum of `8` and maximum of `2048`.

The following arguments are optional:
fsx_windows_file_system.dns_ips: (Required) A list of up to two IP addresses of DNS servers or domain controllers in the self-managed AD directory. The IP addresses need to be either in the same VPC CIDR range as the file system or in the private IP version 4 (IPv4) address ranges as specified in [RFC 1918](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1918).
fsx_windows_file_system.domain_name: (Required) The fully qualified domain name of the self-managed AD directory. For example, `corp.example.com`.
fsx_windows_file_system.password: (Required) The password for the service account on your self-managed AD domain that Amazon FSx will use to join to your AD domain.
fsx_windows_file_system.username: (Required) The user name for the service account on your self-managed AD domain that Amazon FSx will use to join to your AD domain.

pinpoint_apns_sandbox_channel.certificate: (Required) The pem encoded TLS Certificate from Apple.

  At least one item is required.

dx_bgp_peer.virtual_interface_id: (Required) The ID of the Direct Connect virtual interface on which to create the BGP peer.

load_balancer_backend_server_policy.instance_port: (Required) The instance port to apply the policy to.

networkmanager_connection.connected_device_id: (Required) The ID of the second device in the connection.
networkmanager_connection.device_id: (Required) The ID of the first device in the connection.
networkmanager_connection.global_network_id: (Required) The ID of the global network.

vpclattice_target_group.name: (Required) The name of the target group. The name must be unique within the account. The valid characters are a-z, 0-9, and hyphens (-). You can't use a hyphen as the first or last character, or immediately after another hyphen.
vpclattice_target_group.type:
(Required) The type of target group. Valid Values are `IP` | `LAMBDA` | `INSTANCE` | `ALB`

The following arguments are optional:

cloudwatch_composite_alarm.alarm: (Required) Can be an AlarmName or an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) from an existing alarm.
cloudwatch_composite_alarm.extension_period: (Required) The maximum time in seconds that the composite alarm waits after suppressor alarm goes out of the `ALARM` state. After this time, the composite alarm performs its actions.
cloudwatch_composite_alarm.wait_period: (Required) The maximum time in seconds that the composite alarm waits for the suppressor alarm to go into the `ALARM` state. After this time, the composite alarm performs its actions.
cloudwatch_composite_alarm.alarm_name: (Required) The name for the composite alarm. This name must be unique within the region.
cloudwatch_composite_alarm.alarm_rule: (Required) An expression that specifies which other alarms are to be evaluated to determine this composite alarm's state. For syntax, see [Creating a Composite Alarm](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/monitoring/Create_Composite_Alarm.html). The maximum length is 10240 characters.

chimesdkvoice_sip_rule.name: (Required) The name of the SIP rule.
chimesdkvoice_sip_rule.trigger_type: (Required) The type of trigger assigned to the SIP rule in `trigger_value`. Valid values are `RequestUriHostname` or `ToPhoneNumber`.
chimesdkvoice_sip_rule.trigger_value:
(Required) If `trigger_type` is `RequestUriHostname`, the value can be the outbound host name of an Amazon Chime Voice Connector. If `trigger_type` is `ToPhoneNumber`, the value can be a customer-owned phone number in the E164 format. The Sip Media Application specified in the Sip Rule is triggered if the request URI in an incoming SIP request matches the `RequestUriHostname`, or if the "To" header in the incoming SIP request matches the `ToPhoneNumber` value.

The following arguments are optional:

globalaccelerator_custom_routing_listene.accelerator_arn: (Required) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a custom routing accelerator.

api_gateway_resource.parent_id: (Required) ID of the parent API resource
api_gateway_resource.path_part: (Required) Last path segment of this API resource.

ecs_task_set.service: (Required) The short name or ARN of the ECS service.

ecs_task_set.task_definition:
(Required) The family and revision (`family:revision`) or full ARN of the task definition that you want to run in your service.

Valid Values: `AGENT_EVENTS` | `ATTACHMENTS` | `CALL_RECORDINGS` | `CHAT_TRANSCRIPTS` | `CONTACT_EVALUATIONS` | `CONTACT_TRACE_RECORDS` | `MEDIA_STREAMS` | `REAL_TIME_CONTACT_ANALYSIS_SEGMENTS` | `SCHEDULED_REPORTS` | `SCREEN_RECORDINGS`.

globalaccelerator_custom_routing_endpoin.listener_arn: (Required) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom routing listener.
globalaccelerator_custom_routing_endpoin.from_port: (Required) The first port, inclusive, in the range of ports for the endpoint group that is associated with a custom routing accelerator.

(Required) The last port, inclusive, in the range of ports for the endpoint group that is associated with a custom routing accelerator.

transfer_connector.access_role: (Required) The IAM Role which provides read and write access to the parent directory of the file location mentioned in the StartFileTransfer request.
transfer_connector.url: (Required) The URL of the partners AS2 endpoint or SFTP endpoint.
transfer_connector.compression: (Required) Specifies weather AS2 file is compressed. The valud values are ZLIB and  DISABLED.
transfer_connector.encryption_algorithm: (Required) The algorithm that is used to encrypt the file. The valid values are AES128_CBC | AES192_CBC | AES256_CBC | NONE.
transfer_connector.local_profile_id: (Required) The unique identifier for the AS2 local profile.
transfer_connector.mdn_response: (Required) Used for outbound requests to determine if a partner response for transfers is synchronous or asynchronous. The valid values are SYNC and NONE.
transfer_connector.partner_profile_id: (Required) The unique identifier for the AS2 partner profile.
transfer_connector.signing_algorithm: (Required) The algorithm that is used to sign AS2 messages sent with the connector. The valid values are SHA256 | SHA384 | SHA512 | SHA1 | NONE .
transfer_connector.trusted_host_keys: (Required) A list of public portion of the host key, or keys, that are used to authenticate the user to the external server to which you are connecting.(https://docs.aws.amazon.com/transfer/latest/userguide/API_SftpConnectorConfig.html)
transfer_connector.user_secret_id: (Required) The identifier for the secret (in AWS Secrets Manager) that contains the SFTP user's private key, password, or both. The identifier can be either the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or the name of the secret.

Group names are not distinguished by case. For example, you cannot create groups named both "ADMINS" and "admins".

iam_user_ssh_key.username: (Required) The name of the IAM user to associate the SSH public key with.
iam_user_ssh_key.encoding: (Required) Specifies the public key encoding format to use in the response. To retrieve the public key in ssh-rsa format, use `SSH`. To retrieve the public key in PEM format, use `PEM`.
iam_user_ssh_key.public_key: (Required) The SSH public key. The public key must be encoded in ssh-rsa format or PEM format.

vpclattice_auth_policy.policy: (Required) The auth policy. The policy string in JSON must not contain newlines or blank lines.

devicefarm_instance_profile.name: (Required) The name for the instance profile.

ec2_transit_gateway_connect_peer.inside_cidr_blocks: (Required) The CIDR block that will be used for addressing within the tunnel. It must contain exactly one IPv4 CIDR block and up to one IPv6 CIDR block. The IPv4 CIDR block must be /29 size and must be within 169.254.0.0/16 range, with exception of: 169.254.0.0/29, 169.254.1.0/29, 169.254.2.0/29, 169.254.3.0/29, 169.254.4.0/29, 169.254.5.0/29, 169.254.169.248/29. The IPv6 CIDR block must be /125 size and must be within fd00::/8. The first IP from each CIDR block is assigned for customer gateway, the second and third is for Transit Gateway (An example: from range 169.254.100.0/29, .1 is assigned to customer gateway and .2 and .3 are assigned to Transit Gateway)
ec2_transit_gateway_connect_peer.peer_address: (Required) The IP addressed assigned to customer device, which will be used as tunnel endpoint. It can be IPv4 or IPv6 address, but must be the same address family as `transit_gateway_address`

glacier_vault_lock.complete_lock: (Required) Boolean whether to permanently apply this Glacier Lock Policy. Once completed, this cannot be undone. If set to `false`, the Glacier Lock Policy remains in a testing mode for 24 hours. After that time, the Glacier Lock Policy is automatically removed by Glacier and the Terraform resource will show as needing recreation. Changing this from `false` to `true` will show as resource recreation, which is expected. Changing this from `true` to `false` is not possible unless the Glacier Vault is recreated at the same time.
glacier_vault_lock.policy: (Required) JSON string containing the IAM policy to apply as the Glacier Vault Lock policy.
glacier_vault_lock.vault_name: (Required) The name of the Glacier Vault.
