Fixed-response Blocks (for `fixed_response`) support the following:
lb_listener_rule.content_type: (Required) The content type. Valid values are `text/plain`, `text/css`, `text/html`, `application/javascript` and `application/json`.
lb_listener_rule.user_pool_arn: (Required) The ARN of the Cognito user pool.
lb_listener_rule.user_pool_client_id: (Required) The ID of the Cognito user pool client.
lb_listener_rule.user_pool_domain:
(Required) The domain prefix or fully-qualified domain name of the Cognito user pool.

Authenticate OIDC Blocks (for `authenticate_oidc`) supports the following:
lb_listener_rule.authorization_endpoint: (Required) The authorization endpoint of the IdP.
lb_listener_rule.issuer: (Required) The OIDC issuer identifier of the IdP.
lb_listener_rule.token_endpoint: (Required) The token endpoint of the IdP.
lb_listener_rule.user_info_endpoint:
(Required) The user info endpoint of the IdP.

Authentication Request Extra Params Blocks (for `authentication_request_extra_params`) supports the following:
lb_listener_rule.value: (Required) Query string value pattern to match.
lb_listener_rule.http_header_name: (Required) Name of HTTP header to search. The maximum size is 40 characters. Comparison is case insensitive. Only RFC7240 characters are supported. Wildcards are not supported. You cannot use HTTP header condition to specify the host header, use a `host-header` condition instead.

route53_resolver_firewall_rule_group_ass.name: (Required) A name that lets you identify the rule group association, to manage and use it.
route53_resolver_firewall_rule_group_ass.firewall_rule_group_id: (Required) The unique identifier of the firewall rule group.
route53_resolver_firewall_rule_group_ass.priority: (Required) The setting that determines the processing order of the rule group among the rule groups that you associate with the specified VPC. DNS Firewall filters VPC traffic starting from the rule group with the lowest numeric priority setting.
route53_resolver_firewall_rule_group_ass.vpc_id: (Required) The unique identifier of the VPC that you want to associate with the rule group.

datasync_location_object_storage.agent_arns: (Required) A list of DataSync Agent ARNs with which this location will be associated.
datasync_location_object_storage.bucket_name: (Required) The bucket on the self-managed object storage server that is used to read data from.
datasync_location_object_storage.server_hostname: (Required) The name of the self-managed object storage server. This value is the IP address or Domain Name Service (DNS) name of the object storage server. An agent uses this host name to mount the object storage server in a network.

iam_service_linked_role.aws_service_name: (Required, Forces new resource) The AWS service to which this role is attached. You use a string similar to a URL but without the `http://` in front. For example: `elasticbeanstalk.amazonaws.com`. To find the full list of services that support service-linked roles, check [the docs](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/reference_aws-services-that-work-with-iam.html).

vpc_security_group_egress_rule.security_group_id: (Required) The ID of the security group.

db_proxy.name: (Required) The identifier for the proxy. This name must be unique for all proxies owned by your AWS account in the specified AWS Region. An identifier must begin with a letter and must contain only ASCII letters, digits, and hyphens; it can't end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens.
db_proxy.auth: (Required) Configuration block(s) with authorization mechanisms to connect to the associated instances or clusters. Described below.
db_proxy.engine_family: (Required, Forces new resource) The kinds of databases that the proxy can connect to. This value determines which database network protocol the proxy recognizes when it interprets network traffic to and from the database. For Aurora MySQL, RDS for MariaDB, and RDS for MySQL databases, specify `MYSQL`. For Aurora PostgreSQL and RDS for PostgreSQL databases, specify `POSTGRESQL`. For RDS for Microsoft SQL Server, specify `SQLSERVER`. Valid values are `MYSQL`, `POSTGRESQL`, and `SQLSERVER`.
db_proxy.role_arn: (Required) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that the proxy uses to access secrets in AWS Secrets Manager.
db_proxy.vpc_subnet_ids: (Required) One or more VPC subnet IDs to associate with the new proxy.

datasync_location_fsx_lustre_file_system.fsx_filesystem_arn: (Required) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the FSx for Lustre file system.

dx_hosted_private_virtual_interface_acce.virtual_interface_id: (Required) The ID of the Direct Connect virtual interface to accept.

finspace_kx_environment.name: (Required) Name of the KX environment that you want to create.
finspace_kx_environment.kms_key_id:
(Required) KMS key ID to encrypt your data in the FinSpace environment.

The following arguments are optional:

neptune_cluster_endpoint.cluster_identifier: (Required, Forces new resources) The DB cluster identifier of the DB cluster associated with the endpoint.
neptune_cluster_endpoint.cluster_endpoint_identifier: (Required, Forces new resources) The identifier of the endpoint.
neptune_cluster_endpoint.endpoint_type: (Required) The type of the endpoint. One of: `READER`, `WRITER`, `ANY`.

ecr_lifecycle_policy.repository: (Required) Name of the repository to apply the policy.
ecr_lifecycle_policy.policy: (Required) The policy document. This is a JSON formatted string. See more details about [Policy Parameters](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECR/latest/userguide/LifecyclePolicies.html#lifecycle_policy_parameters) in the official AWS docs.

media_store_container_policy.policy: (Required) The contents of the policy. For more information about building AWS IAM policy documents with Terraform, see the [AWS IAM Policy Document Guide](https://learn.hashicorp.com/terraform/aws/iam-policy).

vpc_endpoint_service_allowed_principal.vpc_endpoint_service_id: (Required) The ID of the VPC endpoint service to allow permission.
vpc_endpoint_service_allowed_principal.principal_arn: (Required) The ARN of the principal to allow permissions.

dms_event_subscription.name: (Required) Name of event subscription.
dms_event_subscription.source_ids: (Required) Ids of sources to listen to.
dms_event_subscription.sns_topic_arn: (Required) SNS topic arn to send events on.

dx_connection.bandwidth: (Required) The bandwidth of the connection. Valid values for dedicated connections: 1Gbps, 10Gbps. Valid values for hosted connections: 50Mbps, 100Mbps, 200Mbps, 300Mbps, 400Mbps, 500Mbps, 1Gbps, 2Gbps, 5Gbps, 10Gbps and 100Gbps. Case sensitive.
dx_connection.location: (Required) The AWS Direct Connect location where the connection is located. See [DescribeLocations](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/directconnect/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeLocations.html) for the list of AWS Direct Connect locations. Use `locationCode`.
dx_connection.name: (Required) The name of the connection.

s3_bucket_object.bucket: (Required) Name of the bucket to put the file in. Alternatively, an [S3 access point](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/using-access-points.html) ARN can be specified.
s3_bucket_object.key:
(Required) Name of the object once it is in the bucket.

The following arguments are optional:

auditmanager_framework_share.destination_account: (Required) Amazon Web Services account of the recipient.
auditmanager_framework_share.destination_region: (Required) Amazon Web Services region of the recipient.
auditmanager_framework_share.framework_id:
(Required) Unique identifier for the shared custom framework.

The following arguments are optional:

codeartifact_domain_permissions_policy.domain: (Required) The name of the domain on which to set the resource policy.
codeartifact_domain_permissions_policy.policy_document: (Required) A JSON policy string to be set as the access control resource policy on the provided domain.

codebuild_webhook.project_name: (Required) The name of the build project.
codebuild_webhook.type: (Required) The webhook filter group's type. Valid values for this parameter are: `EVENT`, `BASE_REF`, `HEAD_REF`, `ACTOR_ACCOUNT_ID`, `FILE_PATH`, `COMMIT_MESSAGE`. At least one filter group must specify `EVENT` as its type.
codebuild_webhook.pattern: (Required) For a filter that uses `EVENT` type, a comma-separated string that specifies one event: `PUSH`, `PULL_REQUEST_CREATED`, `PULL_REQUEST_UPDATED`, `PULL_REQUEST_REOPENED`. `PULL_REQUEST_MERGED` works with GitHub & GitHub Enterprise only. For a filter that uses any of the other filter types, a regular expression.

medialive_multiplex.availability_zones: (Required) A list of availability zones. You must specify exactly two.
medialive_multiplex.name:
(Required) name of Multiplex.

The following arguments are optional:

networkmanager_device.global_network_id: (Required) The ID of the global network.

autoscaling_attachment.autoscaling_group_name: (Required) Name of ASG to associate with the ELB.

docdb_cluster.master_password:
(Required unless a `snapshot_identifier` or unless a `global_cluster_identifier` is provided when the cluster is the "secondary" cluster of a global database) Password for the master DB user. Note that this may
    show up in logs, and it will be stored in the state file. Please refer to the DocumentDB Naming Constraints.
docdb_cluster.master_username: (Required unless a `snapshot_identifier` or unless a `global_cluster_identifier` is provided when the cluster is the "secondary" cluster of a global database) Username for the master DB user.

lightsail_key_pair.public_key: (Required) The public key material. This public key will be imported into Lightsail

ssm_maintenance_window_target.window_id: (Required) The Id of the maintenance window to register the target with.
ssm_maintenance_window_target.resource_type: (Required) The type of target being registered with the Maintenance Window. Possible values are `INSTANCE` and `RESOURCE_GROUP`.
ssm_maintenance_window_target.targets:
(Required) The targets to register with the maintenance window. In other words, the instances to run commands on when the maintenance window runs. You can specify targets using instance IDs, resource group names, or tags that have been applied to instances. For more information about these examples formats see
 (https://docs.aws.amazon.com/systems-manager/latest/userguide/mw-cli-tutorial-targets-examples.html)

dynamodb_global_table.name: (Required) The name of the global table. Must match underlying DynamoDB Table names in all regions.
dynamodb_global_table.replica: (Required) Underlying DynamoDB Table. At least 1 replica must be defined. See below.
dynamodb_global_table.region_name: (Required) AWS region name of replica DynamoDB TableE.g., `us-east-1`

elastictranscoder_pipeline.input_bucket: (Required) The Amazon S3 bucket in which you saved the media files that you want to transcode and the graphics that you want to use as watermarks.
elastictranscoder_pipeline.role: (Required) The IAM Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the role that you want Elastic Transcoder to use to transcode jobs for this pipeline.

config_organization_managed_rule.name: (Required) The name of the rule
config_organization_managed_rule.rule_identifier: (Required) Identifier of an available AWS Config Managed Rule to call. For available values, see the [List of AWS Config Managed Rules](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/config/latest/developerguide/managed-rules-by-aws-config.html) documentation

network_interface.subnet_id:
(Required) Subnet ID to create the ENI in.

The following arguments are optional:

verifiedaccess_group.verifiedaccess_instance_id:
(Required) The id of the verified access instance this group is associated with.

The following arguments are optional:

backup_framework.name: (Required) The name of a control. This name is between 1 and 256 characters.

pinpoint_apns_channel.certificate: (Required) The pem encoded TLS Certificate from Apple.
pinpoint_apns_channel.private_key:
(Required) The Certificate Private Key file (ie. `.key` file).

If you choose to use __Key credentials__ you will have to provide:
pinpoint_apns_channel.bundle_id: (Required) The ID assigned to your iOS app. To find this value, choose Certificates, IDs & Profiles, choose App IDs in the Identifiers section, and choose your app.
pinpoint_apns_channel.team_id: (Required) The ID assigned to your Apple developer account team. This value is provided on the Membership page.
pinpoint_apns_channel.token_key: (Required) The `.p8` file that you download from your Apple developer account when you create an authentication key.
pinpoint_apns_channel.token_key_id: (Required) The ID assigned to your signing key. To find this value, choose Certificates, IDs & Profiles, and choose your key in the Keys section.

lightsail_bucket_access_key.bucket_name: (Required) The name of the bucket that the new access key will belong to, and grant access to.

quicksight_group_membership.group_name: (Required) The name of the group in which the member will be added.
quicksight_group_membership.member_name: (Required) The name of the member to add to the group.
quicksight_group_membership.namespace: (Required) The namespace that you want the user to be a part of. Defaults to `default`.

backup_vault_lock_configuration.backup_vault_name: (Required) Name of the backup vault to add a lock configuration for.

ec2_availability_zone_group.group_name: (Required) Name of the Availability Zone Group.
ec2_availability_zone_group.opt_in_status: (Required) Indicates whether to enable or disable Availability Zone Group. Valid values: `opted-in` or `not-opted-in`.

elastictranscoder_preset.container: (Required, Forces new resource) The container type for the output file. Valid values are `flac`, `flv`, `fmp4`, `gif`, `mp3`, `mp4`, `mpg`, `mxf`, `oga`, `ogg`, `ts`, and `webm`.

guardduty_organization_configuration_fea.detector_id: (Required) The ID of the detector that configures the delegated administrator.

emrcontainers_job_template.job_template_data: (Required) The job template data which holds values of StartJobRun API request.
emrcontainers_job_template.name: (Required) The specified name of the job template.
emrcontainers_job_template.execution_role_arn: (Required) The execution role ARN of the job run.
emrcontainers_job_template.job_driver: (Required) Specify the driver that the job runs on. Exactly one of the two available job drivers is required, either sparkSqlJobDriver or sparkSubmitJobDriver.
emrcontainers_job_template.release_label: (Required) The release version of Amazon EMR.
emrcontainers_job_template.log_group_name: (Required) The name of the log group for log publishing.
emrcontainers_job_template.entry_point: (Required) The entry point of job application.

ami_copy.name: (Required) Region-unique name for the AMI.
ami_copy.source_ami_id:
(Required) Id of the AMI to copy. This id must be valid in the region
  given by `source_ami_region`.
ami_copy.source_ami_region:
(Required) Region from which the AMI will be copied. This may be the
  same as the AWS provider region in order to create a copy within the same region.

egress_only_internet_gateway.vpc_id: (Required) The VPC ID to create in.

location_route_calculator.calculator_name: (Required) The name of the route calculator resource.
location_route_calculator.data_source:
(Required) Specifies the data provider of traffic and road network data.

The following arguments are optional:

servicecatalog_principal_portfolio_assoc.principal_arn:
(Required) Principal ARN.

The following arguments are optional:

ssmcontacts_plan.contact_id: (Required) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact or escalation plan.
ssmcontacts_plan.stage: (Required) List of stages. A contact has an engagement plan with stages that contact specified contact channels. An escalation plan uses stages that contact specified contacts.

s3_bucket_lifecycle_configuration.bucket: (Required) Name of the source S3 bucket you want Amazon S3 to monitor.

fsx_ontap_volume.size_in_megabytes: (Required) Specifies the size of the volume, in megabytes (MB), that you are creating.
fsx_ontap_volume.storage_virtual_machine_id: (Required) Specifies the storage virtual machine in which to create the volume.
fsx_ontap_volume.default_retention: (Required) The retention period assigned to a write once, read many (WORM) file by default if an explicit retention period is not set for an FSx for ONTAP SnapLock volume. The default retention period must be greater than or equal to the minimum retention period and less than or equal to the maximum retention period. See [Retention Period](#retention-period) below.
fsx_ontap_volume.maximum_retention: (Required) The longest retention period that can be assigned to a WORM file on an FSx for ONTAP SnapLock volume. See [Retention Period](#retention-period) below.
fsx_ontap_volume.minimum_retention: (Required) The shortest retention period that can be assigned to a WORM file on an FSx for ONTAP SnapLock volume. See [Retention Period](#retention-period) below.

glue_job.command: (Required) The command of the job. Defined below.
glue_job.name: (Required) The name you assign to this job. It must be unique in your account.
glue_job.role_arn: (Required) The ARN of the IAM role associated with this job.
glue_job.script_location: (Required) Specifies the S3 path to a script that executes a job.

ec2_capacity_reservation.availability_zone: (Required) The Availability Zone in which to create the Capacity Reservation.
ec2_capacity_reservation.instance_count: (Required) The number of instances for which to reserve capacity.
ec2_capacity_reservation.instance_platform: (Required) The type of operating system for which to reserve capacity. Valid options are `Linux/UNIX`, `Red Hat Enterprise Linux`, `SUSE Linux`, `Windows`, `Windows with SQL Server`, `Windows with SQL Server Enterprise`, `Windows with SQL Server Standard` or `Windows with SQL Server Web`.
ec2_capacity_reservation.instance_type: (Required) The instance type for which to reserve capacity.

securityhub_action_target.name: (Required) The description for the custom action target.
securityhub_action_target.identifier: (Required) The ID for the custom action target.
securityhub_action_target.description: (Required) The name of the custom action target.

kms_grant.key_id: (Required, Forces new resources) The unique identifier for the customer master key (CMK) that the grant applies to. Specify the key ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK. To specify a CMK in a different AWS account, you must use the key ARN.
kms_grant.grantee_principal: (Required, Forces new resources) The principal that is given permission to perform the operations that the grant permits in ARN format. Note that due to eventual consistency issues around IAM principals, terraform's state may not always be refreshed to reflect what is true in AWS.
kms_grant.operations: (Required, Forces new resources) A list of operations that the grant permits. The permitted values are: `Decrypt`, `Encrypt`, `GenerateDataKey`, `GenerateDataKeyWithoutPlaintext`, `ReEncryptFrom`, `ReEncryptTo`, `Sign`, `Verify`, `GetPublicKey`, `CreateGrant`, `RetireGrant`, `DescribeKey`, `GenerateDataKeyPair`, or `GenerateDataKeyPairWithoutPlaintext`.

sagemaker_model.execution_role_arn: (Required) A role that SageMaker can assume to access model artifacts and docker images for deployment.

budgets_budget.budget_type: (Required) Whether this budget tracks monetary cost or usage.
budgets_budget.limit_amount: (Required) The amount of cost or usage being measured for a budget.
budgets_budget.limit_unit: (Required) The unit of measurement used for the budget forecast, actual spend, or budget threshold, such as dollars or GB. See [Spend](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/awsaccountbilling/latest/aboutv2/data-type-spend.html) documentation.
budgets_budget.time_unit: (Required) The length of time until a budget resets the actual and forecasted spend. Valid values: `MONTHLY`, `QUARTERLY`, `ANNUALLY`, and `DAILY`.
budgets_budget.comparison_operator: (Output Only) (Required) Comparison operator to use to evaluate the condition. Can be `LESS_THAN`, `EQUAL_TO` or `GREATER_THAN`.
budgets_budget.threshold: (Output Only) (Required) Threshold when the notification should be sent.
budgets_budget.threshold_type: (Output Only) (Required) What kind of threshold is defined. Can be `PERCENTAGE` OR `ABSOLUTE_VALUE`.
budgets_budget.notification_type: (Output Only) (Required) What kind of budget value to notify on. Can be `ACTUAL` or `FORECASTED`
budgets_budget.start_time: (Output Only) (Required) The start time of the budget limit. Format: `2017-01-01_12:00`. See [PlannedBudgetLimits](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/aws-cost-management/latest/APIReference/API_budgets_Budget.html#awscostmanagement-Type-budgets_Budget-PlannedBudgetLimits) documentation.
budgets_budget.amount: (Output Only) (Required) The amount of cost or usage being measured for a budget.
budgets_budget.unit: (Output Only) (Required) The unit of measurement used for the budget forecast, actual spend, or budget threshold, such as dollars or GB. See [Spend](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/awsaccountbilling/latest/aboutv2/data-type-spend.html) documentation.

iot_logging_options.role_arn: (Required) The ARN of the role that allows IoT to write to Cloudwatch logs.

s3outposts_endpoint.outpost_id: (Required) Identifier of the Outpost to contain this endpoint.
s3outposts_endpoint.security_group_id: (Required) Identifier of the EC2 Security Group.

s3_bucket_cors_configuration.bucket: (Required, Forces new resource) Name of the bucket.

sagemaker_code_repository.code_repository_name: (Required) The name of the Code Repository (must be unique).

connect_vocabulary.content: (Required) The content of the custom vocabulary in plain-text format with a table of values. Each row in the table represents a word or a phrase, described with Phrase, IPA, SoundsLike, and DisplayAs fields. Separate the fields with TAB characters. For more information, see [Create a custom vocabulary using a table](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/transcribe/latest/dg/custom-vocabulary.html#create-vocabulary-table). Minimum length of `1`. Maximum length of `60000`.
connect_vocabulary.instance_id: (Required) Specifies the identifier of the hosting Amazon Connect Instance.
connect_vocabulary.language_code: (Required) The language code of the vocabulary entries. For a list of languages and their corresponding language codes, see [What is Amazon Transcribe?](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/transcribe/latest/dg/transcribe-whatis.html). Valid Values are `ar-AE`, `de-CH`, `de-DE`, `en-AB`, `en-AU`, `en-GB`, `en-IE`, `en-IN`, `en-US`, `en-WL`, `es-ES`, `es-US`, `fr-CA`, `fr-FR`, `hi-IN`, `it-IT`, `ja-JP`, `ko-KR`, `pt-BR`, `pt-PT`, `zh-CN`.
connect_vocabulary.name: (Required) A unique name of the custom vocabulary. Must not be more than 140 characters.

iot_provisioning_template.name: (Required) The name of the fleet provisioning template.
iot_provisioning_template.provisioning_role_arn: (Required) The role ARN for the role associated with the fleet provisioning template. This IoT role grants permission to provision a device.
iot_provisioning_template.template_body: (Required) The JSON formatted contents of the fleet provisioning template.

sagemaker_model_package_group.model_package_group_name: (Required) The name of the model group.

lightsail_disk.name: (Required) The name of the Lightsail load balancer.
lightsail_disk.size_in_gb: (Required) The instance port the load balancer will connect.
lightsail_disk.availability_zone: (Required) The Availability Zone in which to create your disk.

pinpoint_apns_voip_channel.certificate: (Required) The pem encoded TLS Certificate from Apple.
pinpoint_apns_voip_channel.private_key:
(Required) The Certificate Private Key file (ie. `.key` file).

If you choose to use __Key credentials__ you will have to provide:
pinpoint_apns_voip_channel.bundle_id: (Required) The ID assigned to your iOS app. To find this value, choose Certificates, IDs & Profiles, choose App IDs in the Identifiers section, and choose your app.
pinpoint_apns_voip_channel.team_id: (Required) The ID assigned to your Apple developer account team. This value is provided on the Membership page.
pinpoint_apns_voip_channel.token_key: (Required) The `.p8` file that you download from your Apple developer account when you create an authentication key.
pinpoint_apns_voip_channel.token_key_id: (Required) The ID assigned to your signing key. To find this value, choose Certificates, IDs & Profiles, and choose your key in the Keys section.

storagegateway_file_system_association.gateway_arn: (Required) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway.
storagegateway_file_system_association.location_arn: (Required) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon FSx file system to associate with the FSx File Gateway.
storagegateway_file_system_association.username: (Required) The user name of the user credential that has permission to access the root share of the Amazon FSx file system. The user account must belong to the Amazon FSx delegated admin user group.
storagegateway_file_system_association.password: (Required, sensitive) The password of the user credential.

appintegrations_data_integration.kms_key: (Required) Specifies the KMS key Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the Data Integration.
appintegrations_data_integration.name: (Required) Specifies the name of the Data Integration.
appintegrations_data_integration.source_uri: (Required) Specifies the URI of the data source. Create an [AppFlow Connector Profile](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/aws/latest/docs/resources/appflow_connector_profile) and reference the name of the profile in the URL. An example of this value for Salesforce is `Salesforce://AppFlow/example` where `example` is the name of the AppFlow Connector Profile.
appintegrations_data_integration.first_execution_from: (Required) The start date for objects to import in the first flow run as an Unix/epoch timestamp in milliseconds or in ISO-8601 format. This needs to be a time in the past, meaning that the data created or updated before this given date will not be downloaded.
appintegrations_data_integration.object: (Required) The name of the object to pull from the data source. Examples of objects in Salesforce include `Case`, `Account`, or `Lead`.
appintegrations_data_integration.schedule_expression: (Required) How often the data should be pulled from data source. Examples include `rate(1 hour)`, `rate(3 hours)`, `rate(1 day)`.

wafregional_rule_group.name: (Required) A friendly name of the rule group
wafregional_rule_group.metric_name: (Required) A friendly name for the metrics from the rule group

iot_policy.name: (Required) The name of the policy.
iot_policy.policy: (Required) The policy document. This is a JSON formatted string. Use the [IoT Developer Guide](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/iot/latest/developerguide/iot-policies.html) for more information on IoT Policies. For more information about building AWS IAM policy documents with Terraform, see the [AWS IAM Policy Document Guide](https://learn.hashicorp.com/terraform/aws/iam-policy).

lightsail_lb.name: (Required) The name of the Lightsail load balancer.
lightsail_lb.instance_port: (Required) The instance port the load balancer will connect.

servicecatalog_constraint.type:
(Required) Type of constraint. Valid values are `LAUNCH`, `NOTIFICATION`, `RESOURCE_UPDATE`, `STACKSET`, and `TEMPLATE`.

The following arguments are optional:

waf_geo_match_set.name: (Required) The name or description of the GeoMatchSet.

autoscaling_policy.scaling_adjustment:
(Required) Number of members by which to
scale, when the adjustment bounds are breached. A positive value scales
up. A negative value scales down.
autoscaling_policy.metric_specification: (Required) This structure includes the metrics and target utilization to use for predictive scaling.

cloudsearch_domain_service_access_policy.access_policy: (Required) The access rules you want to configure. These rules replace any existing rules. See the [AWS documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cloudsearch/latest/developerguide/configuring-access.html) for details.
cloudsearch_domain_service_access_policy.domain_name: (Required) The CloudSearch domain name the policy applies to.

elasticache_global_replication_group.global_replication_group_id_suffix: (Required) The suffix name of a Global Datastore. If `global_replication_group_id_suffix` is changed, creates a new resource.
elasticache_global_replication_group.primary_replication_group_id: (Required) The ID of the primary cluster that accepts writes and will replicate updates to the secondary cluster. If `primary_replication_group_id` is changed, creates a new resource.

spot_datafeed_subscription.bucket: (Required) The Amazon S3 bucket in which to store the Spot instance data feed.

storagegateway_stored_iscsi_volume.gateway_arn: (Required) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway.
storagegateway_stored_iscsi_volume.network_interface_id: (Required) The network interface of the gateway on which to expose the iSCSI target. Only IPv4 addresses are accepted.
storagegateway_stored_iscsi_volume.target_name: (Required) The name of the iSCSI target used by initiators to connect to the target and as a suffix for the target ARN. The target name must be unique across all volumes of a gateway.
storagegateway_stored_iscsi_volume.disk_id: (Required) The unique identifier for the gateway local disk that is configured as a stored volume.
storagegateway_stored_iscsi_volume.preserve_existing_data: (Required) Specify this field as `true` if you want to preserve the data on the local disk. Otherwise, specifying this field as false creates an empty volume.

transfer_user.server_id: (Required) The Server ID of the Transfer Server (e.g., `s-12345678`)
transfer_user.user_name: (Required) The name used for log in to your SFTP server.
transfer_user.role: (Required) Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that allows the service to control your userâ€™s access to your Amazon S3 bucket.

opensearchserverless_security_config.name: (Required, Forces new resource) Name of the policy.
opensearchserverless_security_config.type:
(Required) Type of configuration. Must be `saml`.

The following arguments are optional:

rds_global_cluster.global_cluster_identifier: (Required, Forces new resources) Global cluster identifier.

kendra_index.role_arn: (Required) An AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that gives Amazon Kendra permissions to access your Amazon CloudWatch logs and metrics. This is also the role you use when you call the `BatchPutDocument` API to index documents from an Amazon S3 bucket.

quicksight_data_source.data_source_id: (Required, Forces new resource) An identifier for the data source.
quicksight_data_source.name: (Required) A name for the data source, maximum of 128 characters.
quicksight_data_source.type:
(Required) The type of the data source. See the [AWS Documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/quicksight/latest/APIReference/API_CreateDataSource.html#QS-CreateDataSource-request-Type) for the complete list of valid values.

The following arguments are optional:
quicksight_data_source.username: (Required) User name, maximum length of 64 characters.
quicksight_data_source.actions: (Required) Set of IAM actions to grant or revoke permissions on. Max of 16 items.
quicksight_data_source.principal: (Required) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the principal.
quicksight_data_source.disable_ssl: (Required) A Boolean option to control whether SSL should be disabled.
quicksight_data_source.vpc_connection_arn: (Required) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the VPC connection.
quicksight_data_source.database: (Required) The database to which to connect.
quicksight_data_source.host: (Required) The host to which to connect.
quicksight_data_source.port: (Required) The warehouse to which to connect.
quicksight_data_source.data_set_name: (Required) The name of the data set to which to connect.
quicksight_data_source.site_base_url: (Required) The base URL of the Jira instance's site to which to connect.
quicksight_data_source.catalog: (Required) The catalog to which to connect.
quicksight_data_source.manifest_file_location: (Required) An [object containing the S3 location](#manifest_file_location-argument-reference) of the S3 manifest file.
quicksight_data_source.bucket: (Required) The name of the bucket that contains the manifest file.
quicksight_data_source.key: (Required) The key of the manifest file within the bucket.
quicksight_data_source.warehouse: (Required) The warehouse to which to connect.
quicksight_data_source.max_rows: (Required) The maximum number of rows to query.
quicksight_data_source.query: (Required) The Twitter query to retrieve the data.

dx_hosted_connection.name: (Required) The name of the connection.
dx_hosted_connection.bandwidth: (Required) The bandwidth of the connection. Valid values for dedicated connections: 1Gbps, 10Gbps. Valid values for hosted connections: 50Mbps, 100Mbps, 200Mbps, 300Mbps, 400Mbps, 500Mbps, 1Gbps, 2Gbps, 5Gbps and 10Gbps. Case sensitive.
dx_hosted_connection.connection_id: (Required) The ID of the interconnect or LAG.
dx_hosted_connection.owner_account_id: (Required) The ID of the AWS account of the customer for the connection.
dx_hosted_connection.vlan: (Required) The dedicated VLAN provisioned to the hosted connection.

eks_node_group.cluster_name: (Required) Name of the EKS Cluster. Must be between 1-100 characters in length. Must begin with an alphanumeric character, and must only contain alphanumeric characters, dashes and underscores (`^[0-9A-Za-z][A-Za-z0-9\-_]+$`).
eks_node_group.node_role_arn: (Required) Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM Role that provides permissions for the EKS Node Group.
eks_node_group.scaling_config: (Required) Configuration block with scaling settings. See [`scaling_config`](#scaling_config-configuration-block) below for details.
eks_node_group.subnet_ids:
(Required) Identifiers of EC2 Subnets to associate with the EKS Node Group.

The following arguments are optional:
eks_node_group.version: (Required) EC2 Launch Template version number. While the API accepts values like `$Default` and `$Latest`, the API will convert the value to the associated version number (e.g., `1`) on read and Terraform will show a difference on next plan. Using the `default_version` or `latest_version` attribute of the `aws_launch_template` resource or data source is recommended for this argument.
eks_node_group.key: (Required) The key of the taint. Maximum length of 63.
eks_node_group.effect: (Required) The effect of the taint. Valid values: `NO_SCHEDULE`, `NO_EXECUTE`, `PREFER_NO_SCHEDULE`.

internetmonitor_monitor.monitor_name:
(Required) The name of the monitor.

The following arguments are optional:

iot_certificate.active: (Required)  Boolean flag to indicate if the certificate should be active

xray_sampling_rule.rule_name: (Required) The name of the sampling rule.
xray_sampling_rule.resource_arn: (Required) Matches the ARN of the AWS resource on which the service runs.
xray_sampling_rule.priority: (Required) The priority of the sampling rule.
xray_sampling_rule.fixed_rate: (Required) The percentage of matching requests to instrument, after the reservoir is exhausted.
xray_sampling_rule.reservoir_size: (Required) A fixed number of matching requests to instrument per second, prior to applying the fixed rate. The reservoir is not used directly by services, but applies to all services using the rule collectively.
xray_sampling_rule.service_name: (Required) Matches the `name` that the service uses to identify itself in segments.
xray_sampling_rule.service_type: (Required) Matches the `origin` that the service uses to identify its type in segments.
xray_sampling_rule.host: (Required) Matches the hostname from a request URL.
xray_sampling_rule.http_method: (Required) Matches the HTTP method of a request.
xray_sampling_rule.url_path: (Required) Matches the path from a request URL.
xray_sampling_rule.version: (Required) The version of the sampling rule format (`1` )

sagemaker_workforce.workforce_name: (Required) The name of the Workforce (must be unique).

verifiedaccess_instance_trust_provider_a.verifiedaccess_instance_id: (Required) The ID of the Verified Access instance to attach the Trust Provider to.
verifiedaccess_instance_trust_provider_a.verifiedaccess_trust_provider_id: (Required) The ID of the Verified Access trust provider.

cloudfront_cache_policy.name: (Required) Unique name used to identify the cache policy.
cloudfront_cache_policy.min_ttl: (Required) Minimum amount of time, in seconds, that objects should remain in the CloudFront cache before a new request is sent to the origin to check for updates.
cloudfront_cache_policy.query_string_behavior: (Required) Whether URL query strings in viewer requests are included in the cache key and automatically included in requests that CloudFront sends to the origin. Valid values for `query_string_behavior` are `none`, `whitelist`, `allExcept`, and `all`.

kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.name: (Required) The name of the HTTP endpoint common attribute.
kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.destination:
(Required) This is the destination to where the data is delivered. The only options are `s3` (Deprecated, use `extended_s3` instead), `extended_s3`, `redshift`, `elasticsearch`, `splunk`, `http_endpoint`, `opensearch` and `opensearchserverless`.
is redshift). More details are given below.
kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.kinesis_stream_arn: (Required) The kinesis stream used as the source of the firehose delivery stream.
kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.authentication_configuration: (Required) The authentication configuration of the Amazon MSK cluster. More details are given below.
kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.msk_cluster_arn: (Required) The ARN of the Amazon MSK cluster.
kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.topic_name:
(Required) The topic name within the Amazon MSK cluster.

The `authentication_configuration` object supports the following:
kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.connectivity: (Required) The type of connectivity used to access the Amazon MSK cluster. Valid values: `PUBLIC`, `PRIVATE`.
kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.cluster_jdbcurl: (Required) The jdbcurl of the redshift cluster.
kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.username: (Required) The username that the firehose delivery stream will assume. It is strongly recommended that the username and password provided is used exclusively for Amazon Kinesis Firehose purposes, and that the permissions for the account are restricted for Amazon Redshift INSERT permissions.
kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.password: (Required) The password for the username above.
kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.data_table_name: (Required) The name of the table in the redshift cluster that the s3 bucket will copy to.
kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.index_name: (Required) The Serverless offering for Amazon OpenSearch Service index name.
kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.collection_endpoint: (Required) The endpoint to use when communicating with the collection in the Serverless offering for Amazon OpenSearch Service.
kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.hec_endpoint: (Required) The HTTP Event Collector (HEC) endpoint to which Kinesis Firehose sends your data.
kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.hec_token: (Required) The GUID that you obtain from your Splunk cluster when you create a new HEC endpoint.
kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.url: (Required) The HTTP endpoint URL to which Kinesis Firehose sends your data.
kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.type: (Required) The type of processor. Valid Values: `RecordDeAggregation`, `Lambda`, `MetadataExtraction`, `AppendDelimiterToRecord`. Validation is done against [AWS SDK constants](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sdk-for-go/api/service/firehose/#pkg-constants); so that values not explicitly listed may also work.
kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.parameter_name: (Required) Parameter name. Valid Values: `LambdaArn`, `NumberOfRetries`, `MetadataExtractionQuery`, `JsonParsingEngine`, `RoleArn`, `BufferSizeInMBs`, `BufferIntervalInSeconds`, `SubRecordType`, `Delimiter`. Validation is done against [AWS SDK constants](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sdk-for-go/api/service/firehose/#pkg-constants); so that values not explicitly listed may also work.
kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.parameter_value:
(Required) Parameter value. Must be between 1 and 512 length (inclusive). When providing a Lambda ARN, you should specify the resource version as well.

~> NOTE: Parameters with default values, including `NumberOfRetries`(default: 3), `RoleArn`(default: firehose role ARN), `BufferSizeInMBs`(default: 3), and `BufferIntervalInSeconds`(default: 60), are not stored in terraform state. To prevent perpetual differences, it is therefore recommended to only include parameters with non-default values.

The `request_configuration` object supports the following:
kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.value:
(Required) The value of the HTTP endpoint common attribute.

The `vpc_config` object supports the following:
kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.subnet_ids: (Required) A list of subnet IDs to associate with Kinesis Firehose.
kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.security_group_ids: (Required) A list of security group IDs to associate with Kinesis Firehose.
kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.input_format_configuration: (Required) Nested argument that specifies the deserializer that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use to convert the format of your data from JSON. More details below.
kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.output_format_configuration: (Required) Nested argument that specifies the serializer that you want Kinesis Data Firehose to use to convert the format of your data to the Parquet or ORC format. More details below.
kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.schema_configuration: (Required) Nested argument that specifies the AWS Glue Data Catalog table that contains the column information. More details below.

db_proxy_default_target_group.db_proxy_name: (Required) Name of the RDS DB Proxy.

opsworks_nodejs_app_layer.stack_id: (Required) ID of the stack the layer will belong to.
opsworks_nodejs_app_layer.mount_point: (Required) The path to mount the EBS volume on the layer's instances.
opsworks_nodejs_app_layer.size: (Required) The size of the volume in gigabytes.
opsworks_nodejs_app_layer.number_of_disks: (Required) The number of disks to use for the EBS volume.
opsworks_nodejs_app_layer.raid_level: (Required) The RAID level to use for the volume.

synthetics_group_association.group_name: (Required) Name of the group that the canary will be associated with.

servicequotas_template.region: (Required) AWS Region to which the template applies.
servicequotas_template.quota_code: (Required) Quota identifier. To find the quota code for a specific quota, use the [aws_servicequotas_service_quota](../d/servicequotas_service_quota.html.markdown) data source.
servicequotas_template.service_code: (Required) Service identifier. To find the service code value for an AWS service, use the [aws_servicequotas_service](../d/servicequotas_service.html.markdown) data source.
servicequotas_template.value: (Required) The new, increased value for the quota.

licensemanager_grant.name: (Required) The Name of the grant.
licensemanager_grant.allowed_operations: (Required) A list of the allowed operations for the grant. This is a subset of the allowed operations on the license.
licensemanager_grant.license_arn: (Required) The ARN of the license to grant.
licensemanager_grant.principal: (Required) The target account for the grant in the form of the ARN for an account principal of the root user.
licensemanager_grant.home_region: (Required) The home region for the license.

api_gateway_integration.rest_api_id: (Required) ID of the associated REST API.
api_gateway_integration.http_method:
(Required) HTTP method (`GET`, `POST`, `PUT`, `DELETE`, `HEAD`, `OPTION`, `ANY`)
  when calling the associated resource.
api_gateway_integration.type: (Required) Integration input's [type](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/apigateway/api-reference/resource/integration/). Valid values are `HTTP` (for HTTP backends), `MOCK` (not calling any real backend), `AWS` (for AWS services), `AWS_PROXY` (for Lambda proxy integration) and `HTTP_PROXY` (for HTTP proxy integration). An `HTTP` or `HTTP_PROXY` integration with a `connection_type` of `VPC_LINK` is referred to as a private integration and uses a VpcLink to connect API Gateway to a network load balancer of a VPC.

spot_fleet_request.iam_fleet_role:
(Required) Grants the Spot fleet permission to terminate
  Spot instances on your behalf when you cancel its Spot fleet request using
CancelSpotFleetRequests or when the Spot fleet request expires, if you set
terminateInstancesWithExpiration.

s3control_object_lambda_access_point_pol.name: (Required) The name of the Object Lambda Access Point.
s3control_object_lambda_access_point_pol.policy: (Required) The Object Lambda Access Point resource policy document.

networkmanager_link.global_network_id: (Required) The ID of the global network.

workspaces_directory.directory_id: (Required) The directory identifier for registration in WorkSpaces service.

apprunner_vpc_connector.subnets: (Required) List of IDs of subnets that App Runner should use when it associates your service with a custom Amazon VPC. Specify IDs of subnets of a single Amazon VPC. App Runner determines the Amazon VPC from the subnets you specify.

cognito_resource_server.identifier: (Required) An identifier for the resource server.
cognito_resource_server.name: (Required) A name for the resource server.

db_instance_automated_backups_replicatio.source_db_instance_arn: (Required, Forces new resource) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source DB instance for the replicated automated backups, for example, `arn:aws:rds:us-west-2:123456789012:db:mydatabase`.

neptune_cluster_snapshot.db_cluster_identifier: (Required) The DB Cluster Identifier from which to take the snapshot.

transcribe_medical_vocabulary.language_code: (Required) The language code you selected for your medical vocabulary. US English (en-US) is the only language supported with Amazon Transcribe Medical.
transcribe_medical_vocabulary.vocabulary_file_uri: (Required) The Amazon S3 location (URI) of the text file that contains your custom medical vocabulary.
transcribe_medical_vocabulary.vocabulary_name:
(Required) The name of the Medical Vocabulary.

The following arguments are optional:

ec2_client_vpn_endpoint.client_cidr_block: (Required) The IPv4 address range, in CIDR notation, from which to assign client IP addresses. The address range cannot overlap with the local CIDR of the VPC in which the associated subnet is located, or the routes that you add manually. The address range cannot be changed after the Client VPN endpoint has been created. The CIDR block should be /22 or greater.
ec2_client_vpn_endpoint.server_certificate_arn: (Required) The ARN of the ACM server certificate.

ec2_transit_gateway_route_table_propagat.transit_gateway_attachment_id: (Required) Identifier of EC2 Transit Gateway Attachment.
ec2_transit_gateway_route_table_propagat.transit_gateway_route_table_id: (Required) Identifier of EC2 Transit Gateway Route Table.

iam_group_policy_attachment.group: - (Required) The group the policy should be applied to
iam_group_policy_attachment.policy_arn: - (Required) The ARN of the policy you want to apply

route53_health_check.type: (Required) The protocol to use when performing health checks. Valid values are `HTTP`, `HTTPS`, `HTTP_STR_MATCH`, `HTTPS_STR_MATCH`, `TCP`, `CALCULATED`, `CLOUDWATCH_METRIC` and `RECOVERY_CONTROL`.
route53_health_check.request_interval: (Required) The number of seconds between the time that Amazon Route 53 gets a response from your endpoint and the time that it sends the next health-check request.

config_configuration_aggregator.name: (Required) The name of the configuration aggregator.

wafv2_ip_set.name: (Required) A friendly name of the IP set.
wafv2_ip_set.scope: (Required) Specifies whether this is for an AWS CloudFront distribution or for a regional application. Valid values are `CLOUDFRONT` or `REGIONAL`. To work with CloudFront, you must also specify the Region US East (N. Virginia).
wafv2_ip_set.ip_address_version: (Required) Specify IPV4 or IPV6. Valid values are `IPV4` or `IPV6`.
wafv2_ip_set.addresses: (Required) Contains an array of strings that specifies zero or more IP addresses or blocks of IP addresses. All addresses must be specified using Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) notation. WAF supports all IPv4 and IPv6 CIDR ranges except for `/0`.

codestarconnections_host.name: (Required) The name of the host to be created. The name must be unique in the calling AWS account.
codestarconnections_host.provider_endpoint: (Required) The endpoint of the infrastructure to be represented by the host after it is created.
codestarconnections_host.provider_type: (Required) The name of the external provider where your third-party code repository is configured.
codestarconnections_host.security_group_ids: (Required) ID of the security group or security groups associated with the Amazon VPC connected to the infrastructure where your provider type is installed.
codestarconnections_host.subnet_ids: (Required) The ID of the subnet or subnets associated with the Amazon VPC connected to the infrastructure where your provider type is installed.
codestarconnections_host.vpc_id: (Required) The ID of the Amazon VPC connected to the infrastructure where your provider type is installed.

networkmanager_site.global_network_id: (Required) The ID of the Global Network to create the site in.

vpclattice_listener.name: (Required, Forces new resource) Name of the listener. A listener name must be unique within a service. Valid characters are a-z, 0-9, and hyphens (-). You can't use a hyphen as the first or last character, or immediately after another hyphen.
vpclattice_listener.protocol: (Required, Forces new resource) Protocol for the listener. Supported values are `HTTP` or `HTTPS`
vpclattice_listener.status_code: (Required) Custom HTTP status code to return, e.g. a 404 response code. See [Listeners](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc-lattice/latest/ug/listeners.html) in the AWS documentation for a list of supported codes.

chime_voice_connector_origination.voice_connector_id: (Required) The Amazon Chime Voice Connector ID.

ses_template.name: (Required) The name of the template. Cannot exceed 64 characters. You will refer to this name when you send email.

chimesdkmediapipelines_media_insights_pi.name: (Required) Configuration name.
chimesdkmediapipelines_media_insights_pi.resource_access_role_arn: (Required) ARN of IAM Role used by service to invoke processors and sinks specified by configuration elements.

msk_configuration.server_properties: (Required) Contents of the server.properties file. Supported properties are documented in the [MSK Developer Guide](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/msk/latest/developerguide/msk-configuration-properties.html).
msk_configuration.kafka_versions: (Required) List of Apache Kafka versions which can use this configuration.
msk_configuration.name: (Required) Name of the configuration.

redshiftserverless_usage_limit.amount: (Required) The limit amount. If time-based, this amount is in Redshift Processing Units (RPU) consumed per hour. If data-based, this amount is in terabytes (TB) of data transferred between Regions in cross-account sharing. The value must be a positive number.
redshiftserverless_usage_limit.resource_arn: (Required) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Redshift Serverless resource to create the usage limit for.
redshiftserverless_usage_limit.usage_type: (Required) The type of Amazon Redshift Serverless usage to create a usage limit for. Valid values are `serverless-compute` or `cross-region-datasharing`.

appmesh_mesh.name: (Required) Name to use for the service mesh. Must be between 1 and 255 characters in length.

transfer_agreement.access_role: (Required) The IAM Role which provides read and write access to the parent directory of the file location mentioned in the StartFileTransfer request.
transfer_agreement.base_directory: (Required) The landing directory for the files transferred by using the AS2 protocol.
transfer_agreement.local_profile_id: (Required) The unique identifier for the AS2 local profile.
transfer_agreement.partner_profile_id: (Required) The unique identifier for the AS2 partner profile.
transfer_agreement.server_id: (Required) The unique server identifier for the server instance. This is the specific server the agreement uses.

appconfig_hosted_configuration_version.configuration_profile_id: (Required, Forces new resource) Configuration profile ID.
appconfig_hosted_configuration_version.content: (Required, Forces new resource) Content of the configuration or the configuration data.
appconfig_hosted_configuration_version.content_type: (Required, Forces new resource) Standard MIME type describing the format of the configuration content. For more information, see [Content-Type](https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.17).

servicecatalog_portfolio.name: (Required) The name of the portfolio.
servicecatalog_portfolio.provider_name: (Required) Name of the person or organization who owns the portfolio.

db_option_group.engine_name: (Required) Specifies the name of the engine that this option group should be associated with.
db_option_group.major_engine_version: (Required) Specifies the major version of the engine that this option group should be associated with.
